story:
Thinking about getting that new tattoo?

Rad. But perhaps you should first learn what lives on your skin before possibly altering the balance. Your skin is the first line of defense against potential disease-causing bacteria, and some can stem from ink or other foreign objects.  And your skin holds another universe invisible to the naked eye…a microbiome, which you can help characterize via CITIZEN-FUNDED SCIENCE!

How does a "Microbiome" affect you?

Microbes, and specifically bacteria and fungi are all around us, but contrary to popular belief, these microbes are NOT all bad.  Microbes living with us even outnumber our own cells. On the contrary, most are actually beneficial, and many species live with us, including on our skin, in diverse symbiotic microscopic communities of bacteria called “microbiomes”.

Now of course, certain public locales and occupations require extra care for removing these “germs” – such as hospital operating rooms, hotels and restaurants etc.  We want these public, common areas as clean as possible.

However, recent research indicates that people, including parents, have become overly concerned or obsessive about maintaining a microbe free environment. Creating a “sterile” environment is almost impossible to achieve, and not really healthy for us, or the environment.  We endanger our children by limiting the capacity of their immune systems to develop properly.  This is called the Hygiene hypothesis.  This also suggests that we tend to overuse all of those too convenient hand sanitizers, which could be wiping out our "good" microbial symbionts.


So, if microbes are everywhere but mostly harmless, shouldn’t we get to know them a little better? 

Yes, and this Skin Deep project intends to characterize your microbes for you.  But only 1-10% of bacteria can be cultured in the lab.  Identifying taxa requires advanced genomics methods.  In this regard, the National Institutes of Health (NIH)-funded "Human Microbiome Project" or HMP  began to profile human symbiotic bacteria using modern molecular DNA sequencing methods. 

 

The HMP uses  “next generation” sequencing to read the biochemical code of DNA (sequences of A, C, G and T biochemical letters) more quickly. This has increased dramatically in the last several years due to new sequencing technologies.  The Human Microbiome Project has now revealed distinct species of bacteria that live in and on various human anatomical locations, such as our intestines (guts), mouths, uro-genital tract, and our skin.  Most are perfectly normal and are in fact beneficial . We intend to continue the characterization of skin microbiomes. 

However, skin-associated bacteria may not be as well characterized or have acute metabolic health effects as those in the gut. Most skin hosts a distinct community of microbes, which varies more widely than other organs and body locales. Indeed, the skin microbiome may represent one of the most variable human microbiomes of the whole body, which adds to each individual’s uniqueness (For example please read articles by Costello et al (2009) and Caparaso et al (2012) plus links for more background). Naturally occurring bacteria on our skin also breakdown sweat that can cause body odor.

Skin microbiomes often differ between gender, as females have a greater proportion of Lactobacilli than males. Certain types of Propionibacteria also can cause acne.

However, normal skin microbes such as Staphylococcus epidermidis, can also help prevent potential pathogens from attaching to our skin, through competition. The major skin-associated genera are comprised of Corynebacterium, Staphylococcus, and Streptococcus.  Lots of Latin names, which we'll try to explain in plain English in your report. 

Your skin, in some ways, holds your 'next of kin'...
One can say these microbes make up our “long time companions” (or symbionts – see below).  However, science is still far from fully understanding their role in the health of human skin, and so a deeper survey of normal human skin microbiomes across different global populations would help track variation over time and space. Patterns and answers to questions may possibly show up.  How does your skin community fit into the population at large?  Do you have unique taxa or differences in relative numbers compared to others?   What are the effects of lifestyle?   This is where the “Skin Deep Microbiome” project begins:


Project Goals

Goal 1 -  Provide you a detailed profile (sample data shown below) of the bacteria with whom you live. This requires purchasing at least one of the Skin Deep sampling kits (I , II or III), then following the simple instructions for properly collecting skin microbiome samples, included with each chosen Skin Deep sampling kit. It's easy and harmless!  

Goal 2 -  To obtain enough samples (~200) where trends and patterns of skin microbiomes may be discernible and validated.  The Skin Deep Microbiome project will then survey  and describe variations between skin microbiomes across a wide range of populations, hopefully worldwide, and throughout various time intervals. 

With these aims in mind, we are seeking as many skin samples samples as possible through the distribution of any of the Skin Deep I - III kits. The larger sample sizes will help statistically validate this study, and possibly correlate any observed changes with specific environmental variables. 

How does your personal skin microbiome stack up to others in the study? We'll let you know. For the example, we'd see if the large bacilli population detected may have any significance in the context  of corresponding environmental information provided by the donor.



This is NOT a skin disease study. Rather, we wish to better understand exactly what constitutes a “healthy” skin microbiome.  Are there any effects of smoking, use of probiotics or location on microbiome membership?  We thus intend to perform a baseline survey using  “next generation” DNA sequencing technologies that we have in our lab.  This will allow us to start our assessment of skin microbiomes among the various populations around the world. Data could then be used to address various disease or environmental issues in the future. The success of this survey depends on recruiting as many people as possible into our study. We'd like to put your microbiome on the map!

Several levels of rewards ("perks") will be given for participating, but the primary one will be the sample kits (Skin Deep I - III), which we will allow us to send you sampling swabs for your own skin microbiome sample.   Other unique perks such as pens, keychain lights and mouse pads will also be available with generous donations. 

(Please watch the following video for further information on where your microbiome will characterized):


The Impact

Why do we need a Skin Microbiome Project?

This is a citizen backed, non-profit, scientific research study, and a way for the public to become more closely involved in cutting edge science.  For the Budget - All of the proceeds raised from this campaign will go towards research, supporting the students and scientists who run the experiments, collect and analyze the data for this specifically designed project, as well as consumable supplies for DNA sequencing.  For example, besides the costs of molecular supplies, a major portion of donations will support molecular biology student training in MiSeq instrument operation and subsequent genomics and bioinformatics analysis  at Nova Southeastern University. 

Obtaining your skin microbiome data now, while one is healthy, can provide a baseline for future comparisons. The profile may be part of your personalized medical profile.  Understanding natural variation across space and time will be necessary to test the utility of the skin microbiome in future research.

Thus this project centers on how to maintain better health through informed scientific practices and more knowledge.

This project also intends to promote the idea of SYMBIOSIS - the living together of more than one different organism, often to the benefit of all.  Symbiotic interactions in biology are actually the norm, and not the exception in daily life.  As the world's natural habitats undergoes increasing pressure from human activities, pollution, climate change and overpopulation etc, a better understanding of ecological principles is needed more than ever, including how organisms interact and live with each other and affect their environments.

Data will be analyzed objectively and placed into a context that can address specific scientific questions.  For example, we would like to know what constitutes a “healthy” normal microbiome in humans.  Does this differ from one geographic locale to another?  Could one's microbiome be affected by behavior such as smoking or use of antibiotics?  Such questions could be addressed statistically if a large enough population were studied. An example of standard data output showing quantitative, relative numbers of different bacterial groups in a skin sample are shown here.

Moreover, our approach is mostly from a "comparative biology" perspective.  Because a single data point (or statistic) may not mean much in isolation, we have kits that provide "linked" samples so that we can compare differences.  For example, 2 samples will allow us compare differences between two body areas (ear vs elbow skin).  Or we can profile the effects of time on a microbiome if you sent us samples separated over a period of time - e.g. temporal profile.

Similar microbiome projects such as the American Gut project have been successfully launched, but only our project specifically focuses on the skin. 

We have recently added staff from the NSU Dermatology department to our team, led by Dr. Tracy Favreau and research fellow Sergey Arutyunyan M.S.  This may allow us to apply our baseline data to studying more serious dermatological conditions in the future.

In the future, this study could expand to include other anatomical locations to assess variations across a single individual.

Nova Southeastern University is a private, non-profit university (www.nova.edu). 

More details may be answered at our Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)page. 


Protocol

If you sign up for one of the Skin Deep I , II or III sampling kits, please carefully follow the sampling instructions which will be provided with each kit, and briefly summarized in the following video.
.  The full detailed protocol can also be downloaded from the protocol site.

The sampling kits will provide donors a profile of the bacteria with whom they live, provided they follow the detailed instructions for properly collecting their microbiome samples, included with their starter kit.

      1. Samples will be requested from one or both of the following body sites, depending on the kit you choose:  

            a.  Inner crease region at the elbow (otherwise known as the antecubital fossa)

            b.  Area behind the ear, at the junction of the pinna and the post-auricular             

                  skin (retroauricle crease)

2. Isolate and deeply sequence the microbiomes from these regions to generate a profile of the resident, natural microbial communities.

3.  A detailed profile showing the types and relative proportions of bacteria on your skin generated with the universal 16S rRNA gene will be returned to you, similar to data shown in previous microbiome studies (see for example Grice and Segre 2011 paper and other articles referenced below). 

4. Sampling swabs should only be used ONCE, should not be opened and kept in their sterile container until the day of the sampling.  After sampling, swabs should be mailed back to us as promptly as possible via priority or overnight express mail (which we ask as a donation as well).  If there is any delay in sending a swab after sampling, they can be kept in the freezer until mailing time. 

5. To link to any changes in each microbial community we will request you fill out an optional questionnaire, which will be available in both written and online form.  Your kit will include a unique, numerical ID code, which we will use to anonymously track your sample.  Please write this code on sample tube and the online survey as well.  The questions will focus mostly on parameters and features that may affect your skin microbiome composition. 



The Team

Our molecular genetics lab has been carrying out symbiosis research for several years.  Although our focus has mostly been with non-human organisms, understanding members and the processes of symbiosis has been a primary foundation of the lab. 
The scientific environment of the NSU Oceanographic Center (NSU OC) is well suited for the proposed research for many reasons. 
Nova Southeastern University is a not-for-profit, independent university that is classified as a research university with “high research activity” by the Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching, and is one of only 37 universities nationwide to also be awarded Carnegie’s Community Engagement Classification. We have approximately 27,000 students, 162,000 alumni, a sprawling, 314-acre Fort Lauderdale-Davie campus and a presence throughout Florida, the U.S. and nine countries around the world. Through five decades of explosive growth, our reputation for academic excellence and innovation continues to flourish. 
The PI and associated NSUOC faculty have collaborations and ties with many local and national scientific agencies such as the National Coral Reef Institute, the Nature Conservancy, Florida Department of Environmental Protection, NOAA AOML, US Food and Drug Administration, NIH National Cancer Institute, and the US Geological Service (USGS). 

You can meet our team on the links below, or visit our lab's homepage. 

    Testimonies
    "This project encompasses important aspects of microbiology - symbiosis and genomics. FLASM supports various areas of research in microbiology, and thus the Skin Microbiome Project fits into a specific niche that we find very interesting and vital. Their goals for supporting education are also equally important." 
               - Kurt Schesser, PhD (University of Miami Miller School of Medicine) and President of FLASM.

    Risks & Challenges

    The benefits from this project will greatly outweigh the risks to any participant. The physical risk of swabbing is less than shaking a friend's hand.

    Nonetheless, before participating in the project, everyone will be asked for their informed consent, and thus to read and approve the appropriate project “NSU Consent form”  before participating in the study.

    Only bacterial sequences will be analyzed; therefore, your human DNA code will not be sequenced or revealed.

    Everyone's privacy will be protected by making all of the samples completely ANONYMOUS upon receipt by our laboratory. Each sample will be give a unique alphanumerical code for our bookkeeping purposes, and only this code will be available to researchers who work with your sample.

    Data will be de-identified because each sample will have a unique ID-number (for example NSU-SD14-00001) associated with it.

    All ID numbers will be linked back to a spreadsheet with sample information that contains ONLY demographic information such as sample source location, individual gender and age, and an email address so we can send you back your results.  However no personal information will be on this sheet. Personal demographic information will be retained only for those who agree to be in the wider study and to link to microbiome sample results. This information will only be accessible by password. 

    We will give you the option to allow us to keep some demographic information (your geographic locale, ethnic background, age, gender etc.) as part of the study. However, all other personal identifying data (name, address, contact information) linked to your code will not be stored in any database or released on the internet in any way. This contact information will kept by the PI in a secure, locked container. 

    All human-subject aspects of the project have been approved by the Institutional Review Board at the Nova Southeastern University and all animal aspects by the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee.   Copies of the appropriate consent forms can be viewed and will be delivered with each kit.  Please let us know if you will want minors tested.   

    Please check Indiegogo's refund policy but we do not guarantee any specific results - e.g. how many bacterial taxa will be identified or counted in any one person.  You can see expected results in our sample data.  After donations and samples are received, we cannot give refunds.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you cannot afford a Skin Deep sampling kit at this time, its ok.  We have less costlier perks to help out the campaign, or even just a good word to your neighbor would be much appreciated.

    We welcome international participants, however we request you provide an extra $12 for us to ship to your location. 

    Also

    • Please forward a picture of our QR (scan) logo or you can use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word about this campaign.
    • Also please visit our permanent page http://www.skin-microbiome-survey1.net  or friend us https://www.facebook.com/skindeepmicrobiome and https://www.facebook.com/novaosteopathic?fref=nf. 


    For Further Reading

    http://skinmicrobiome.net

    http://www.nytimes.com/2014/05/25/magazine/my-no-soap-no-shampoo-bacteria-rich-hygiene-experiment.html?module=Search&mabReward=relbias%3Aw%2C{%221%22%3A%22RI%3A5%22}&_r=1

    Alekseyenko AV, Perez-Perez GI, De Souza A, Strober B, Gao Z, Bihan M, Li K, Methé BA, Blaser MJ. 2013. Community differentiation of the cutaneous microbiota in psoriasis. Microbiome. 1(1):31. doi: 10.1186/2049-2618-1-31.

    Costello et al. (2009). Bacterial Community Variation in Human Body Habitats Across Space and Time. Science 326, 1694-1697.

    Caporaso JG, Lauber CL, Walters WA, Berg-Lyons D, Huntley J, Fierer N, Owens SM, Betley J, Fraser L, Bauer M, Gormley N, Gilbert JA, Smith G, Knight R. 2012. Ultra-high-throughput microbial community analysis on the Illumina HiSeq and MiSeq platforms. ISME J. 6, 1621-1624.

    Donia MS, Cimermancic P, Schulze CJ, Wieland Brown LC, Martin J, Mitreva M, Clardy J, Linington RG, Fischbach MA. 2014. A systematic analysis of biosynthetic gene clusters in the human microbiome reveals a common family of antibiotics.

    Cell. 2014 Sep 11;158(6):1402-14

    Grice, EA, Segre, JA. 2011. The skin microbiome Nature Reviews Microbiology 9, 244-253 (April 2011)

    HMP -Human Microbiome Project Consortium 2012. A framework for human microbiome research. Nature 486, 215-221, doi:10.1038/nature11209 2012.

    HMP- Human Microbiome Project Consortium -248 Collaborators  2012. Structure, function and diversity of the healthy human microbiome. Nature. 4867402:207-14. doi: 10.1038/nature11234.

    Leach, J. 2012. Honor Thy Symbionts. Human Food Project

    Redford KH, Segre JA, Salafsky N, Del Rio CM, McAloose D. Conversion and the Microbiome. Conserv Biol, 26(2):195-197. 2012. [PubMed]

    Tomic-Canic M, Perez-Perez GI, Blumenberg M. 2014. Cutaneous microbiome studies in the times of affordable sequencing. J Dermatol Sci. 2014 Aug;75(2):82-87. doi: 10.1016/j.jdermsci.2014.05.001.

    Zhou Y, Mihindukulasuriya KA, Gao H, La Rosa PS, Wylie KM, Martin JC, Kota K, Shannon WD, Mitreva M, Sodergren E, Weinstock GM. 2014. Exploration of bacterial community classes in major human habitats. Genome Biol. 2014 May 7;15(5):R66.

Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee.   Copies of the appropriate consent forms can be viewed and will be delivered with each kit.  Please let us know if you will want minors tested.   Please check Indiegogo's refund policy but we do not guarantee any specific results - e.g. how many bacterial taxa will be identified or counted in any one person.  You can see expected results in our sample data.  After donations and samples are received, we cannot give refunds.  Other Ways You Can Help If you cannot afford a Skin Deep sampling kit at this time, its ok.  We have less costlier perks to help out the campaign, or even just a good word to your neighbor would be much appreciated.
We welcome international participants, however we request you provide an extra $12 for us to ship to your location. 
Also

Please forward a picture of our QR (scan) logo or you can use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word about this campaign.
Also please visit our permanent page http://www.skin-microbiome-survey1.net  or friend us https://www.facebook.com/skindeepmicrobiome and https://www.facebook.com/novaosteopathic?fref=nf.

story:
Providing All Green Lights to a Better Tomorrow?

  • My name is William Rowe, M.Ed and I own BellinghamFamilyKarate.com. We have spent almost five years developing programs to serve young people with special needs, young people needing developmental programs (high risk kids), adults suffering from the effects of stress and aging, and seniors with disabilities or mobility issues that lead to social isolation. 
  • Our experience with these groups demonstrates that focusing on fitness,  strength building, flexibility, improved breathing and balance, can greatly reduce anxiety, frustration and depression, improve personal responsibility and decrease social isolation.
  • No two people are exactly alike and there are always obstacles when serving these populations.  We draw from a variety of techniques including: Karate and Martial Arts, Tai Chi, QiGong, Yoga, (GPP) General Physical Preparedness, Physical Therapy and Mental Health.
  • Due to the results we have seen, we are attempting to get our youth programs out into the public and private schools, as well as youth centers. We are also targeting the expansion of in-home, senior center and other small group settings (for adults and seniors) in a way that is both effective for them as well as affordable. 
  • You can make a real difference by helping us reach our youth, adults and seniors who are stuck in ruts, isolated, or do not have access to the specialized services that can help heal body and mind. Their pain is often expressed in socially unacceptable ways and affects whole families & communities, when it gets expressed.


What We Are Requesting 

  • Our immediate goal is $10,000 dollars. 
  • --> This includes the following expenses for implementing the Green Light Empowerment Program (GLEP) in Bellingham, MA and the surrounding communities:
  1. Additional employee costs - $3000
  2. Additional travel expenses - $600
  3. Crowdfunding Finance Fees - $900
  4. Additional Training Equipment - $1000
  5. Facebook Campaign (Creation and Ads) - $800
  6. Google Ad Words - $800
  7. Local Press Release - $600
  8. Online Website Appointment Scheduler - $240 annual fee
  9. Increased Insurance - $600
  10. Legal Fees (revise liability form/medial release) - $500
  11. Accounting (taxes and new hire set up) - $500
  12. Virtual Assistants Services (refactor website, document creation, admin role, crowd funder reward management,  marketing assistance) - $1600
  13.  Karate Uniforms & Belts - $800
  14. Scholarships & Crowdfunder Awards- $1000
  15. Phone & Email Campaign - $400


Exceeding Our Financial Goals

If we can exceed our target donation number we have a number of other growth goals including:

  • Green Light Empowerment (GLEP) membership website site with student achievement reports
  • Courses available for learning and certification (Train the Trainer)
  • Green Light Empowerment services scholarships and award administration
  • Partnership program for schools, community centers and facilities across the country
  • Speaking Requests
  • Learning Seminars (online and in person)
  • Consulting
  • Ownership Opportinities

Benefits of Becoming Part of the Team

 Every contributor of $1 or more towards the GLEP Program will be acknowledged by a welcome to the team personalized thank-you letter.

As a contributor to our program we will also prioritize your suggestions, referrals and feedback.

Other perks will include:

  • Green Light Empowerment Team T-Shirts
  • Personalized Green Light Empowerment Team T-Shirts
  • Individual Student Sponsorship
  • Possible Partnership & Additional Investment Opportunities


Your Impact as a Contributor

What is the value to you in reducing the suffering of others? What is the value in seeing others thrive? If these thoughts stir the passion inside of you, then what we are offering here is an incredible opportunity for you.

Here are the thoughts we have lived by since starting our service:

  • To make a positive impact, one individual at a time.
  • If even one person benefits from our services, then we are successful.
  • Caring for another is often the most effective medicine and surpasses all teaching strategies .

John F. Kennedy, "A rising tide raises all boats!"


Risks & Challenges

  1. Student safety - There is always a physical risk in teaching others anything physical. Medical releases and recent medical physicals are the first step, but we have found good judgement and constant communication are critical. We will continue to gather feedback and implement suggestions by student's and their families to help protect everyone involved as move forward.
  2. Maintaining healthy boundaries for all involved - We avoid teaching situations where we are alone with students. This is a trick of health care providers, teachers and coaches, and helps avoid communications issues that can cause a lot of damage. Currently, we request at least one parent, guardian or spouse for individual training sessions and offer small group sessions as an alternative.
  3.  Severe mental health issues - There will need to be an initial evaluation to ensure that GLEP participant's are suited to our services. In cases where it is not clear, we will seek a written confirmation from a medical authority.  We maintain the right to refuse students that do appear suited to experience success by our services.
  4. Reaching our target markets effectively and efficiently - We currently enjoy an excellent reputation in the community. In addition, we have at least one public school and one private facility with an interest in this launch and have allocated a significant amount of our initial fundraising for expanding our market reach.
  5. Minimizing communication issues that would damage our reputation - Due to the nature of our potential student audiences, we will need to educate and hold all GLEP personnel to a (professional & personal) strict Code of Conduct as part of the terms of their employment.
  6. Prioritizing integrity to minimize liability - Documentation, involving other people in training sessions when necessary, education and communication, are all critical tools to minimizing liability. Our adherence to a strict Code of Conduct with documented processes for handling situations are a must.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, would you consider passing along our information either to potential contributors or people in need of our services!

story:
Here is something about the Baby Life Seat™ and why I'm passionate about getting it to market.

New parents are passionate about the safety of their new babies. They watch over them and stress when they travel with the newest and most dependent member of their family. There is no safety flotation device, or life jacket, on a plane or a boat for babies, until now.

The Baby Life Seat™ relieves a lot of parental worries by being the safest, best constructed and government tested and certified infant travel carrier that will float and keep a baby face up in case of an emergency over water. Locator enabling the Baby Life Seat™ is yet another stress reliever for new parents, so they will always be able to find their Baby Life Seat™.

The Baby Life Seat™ prototype is the first Personal Flotation Device (like a life jacket for adults), for infants. It is an automotive car seat that every parent is familiar with, but it also floats and self rights in the water. It was developed with advice and counsel from the U.S. Coast Guard and it has passed all their tests with real babies (you can see this in the YouTube video) at Underwriters Laboratories.

Your contributions will help complete final engineering and formal re-testing to get the Baby Life Seat™ to market around the world. Now the void in safety devices for babies will be filled when taking your baby from the car, to the airplane and on a boat. Instead of our current standard for infant safety, the new status quo expectation for our babies’ safety will be the same as for adults.

The Baby Life Seat™ will provide safety for babies around the world where there are no other products or competitors like it. Passenger safety is important for travel service providers, all safety focused organizations and government authorities as well as for parents and extended family. The Baby Life Seat™ brings the solution to this universal concern.

There are also 3 current patents with more to come that will protect the Baby Life Seat™ franchise, provide barriers to entry into the market for competitors and make certain that any other product like it meets the highest standards the Baby Life Seat™ will now set.

It’s interesting and important to know that laws already exist requiring personal flotation devices (PFD's) on airplanes and boats. But it isn’t the job of government to develop new technologies, but simply to enforce use of existing devices. Now the Baby Life Seat™ does exist for those transportation providers on airplanes and boats. They will have the device available for the safety of their infant passengers as well.

We obtained the patents, organized the business plan and laid out the rudimentary plans for building the company. I've talked to medical facility staff, government agencies, travel industry executives, life jacket manufacturers, non profit child safety focused organizations, magazine editors for boating and travel and so many more people. The consensus of the experts we’ve spoken to is that the Baby Life Seat™ is long awaited and will be embraced.

Please lend your support, energy and prayers to the Baby Life Seat™ campaign and make a contribution that will help us reach our goal. Share our passion, help us reach the goal of new infant safety for every baby around the world and make a change that matters.

Please contribute what you can to make the Baby Life Seat™ a reality.

story:
Meme McKensie Brown

My name is Jennifer.  I am from a family with a slew of boys.  When I found out we were finally getting a baby girl in our family, I couldn't wait to spoil her. And so meet Meme ...

Meme came into life as a bundle of bouncing brown curls and bright eyes. She has always been the perfect combination - fearless as a tomboy but would play dressup all day long. She is the light of our family. She is the sunshine in our days. She never stops smiling or laughing or loving. She is giving. She is compassionate. She is fighting for her life.

Meme has been fighting ovarian cancer for 4 years - she's only 21. She's given up playing volleyball in college, she's given up her beautiful hair, she's given up her dreams of being a nurse, and we need your help so that she doesn't give up her fight for her life.

Meme needs your help

  • While Aunt Sharon and Uncle David have always been hard working and frugal, Meme's fight has taken a toll on them. Taking care of their baby girl has taken them out of work for months over the four years.
  • Meme's chemo pill is $100 - two times a day
  • Her daily chemo treatments are $1000's - every day for five days a week
  • She also needs your prayers

What your help means

  • Your contributions will go to help pay for Meme’s medical bills
  • Even if we don’t reach our goal, every contribution will be appreciated and used to help pay for Meme’s chemo treatments and pills and the constant pain medications she needs
  • With all Aunt Sharon and Uncle David are going through, help with the medical bills will take one burden off their minds

Other ways to help

  • Forward this to anyone who has been affected by cancer and who wants to help a beautiful, loving family in their fight to save their baby.
  • Check back for updates on Meme’s fight
  • Pray, pray, pray – her only hope is a miracle.  Pray for God to lay His loving hands on my family.

story:
Our Story

My name is Larry Kolthoff and on January 4th 2010 a really good friend of 10 years was diagnosed with Stage 2B Breast Cancer at Memorial Sloan- Kettering Cancer Center in New York City.  My first initial reaction was how can something like this happen to someone soo Sweet, Caring, and Loving?  I mean it really does seem as if bad things really happen to good people.  I didn't understand it and neither did she, but we agreed to fight this thing and solider on with full force and believing that God was on our Side.  Sharon has no immediate family and was living in Portland, OR alone before she came to New York City in 2009 and started work at a sales company here in Nyc.  She has been fighting this fight for over a year now and and it has had a tremendous effect on her personal and financial situation.  After starting her job and making around $35,000 starting pay, she had to quit her job because she no longer had the energy to still work and since she had only been at her job for 5 months she was ineligible for unemployment benefits.  Sharon has absolutely no health care coverage and I am helping her in any way I possible can, the cost of her treatment has been very challenging to us and we have been reaching out to anyone who would be willing to help including charitable organizations which by the grace of god have helped cover a good portion of her expenses, in August of 2010 she decided to go ahead and have the Lumpectomy done which removed half of her right breast.  Ever since she has been receiving 2 day a week cycles of chemotherapy and she is currently well into over a Hundred thousand dollars for her treatment which included Surgery, Chemo sessions and Drug medication costs which we managed to pay 80 percent of with the help of her Generous Community and Non- Profits.  We have been reaching out to anyone who is willing to help her and have been having local bake sales here in NYC to help cover her costs as well, and that's not even factoring in personal expenses bills etc, so it's pretty rough for her.  Throughout it all Sharon has been in High Spirits she can no longer enjoy certain activities she used to but her faith in God has been unshakable and we are praying every day that she will make it through.

story:
Complete Bathroom Remodel

Robert is a Godly man, loving husband and father of two.  His love was Law Enforcement where he made his career until this horrible disease, ALS, took that from him and made him have to retire at a very early age.  He has been truly blessed in that this diesease is moving very slow through his body until about six months ago.  We are now at a stage that it is time to start making modifications to our home to make it safer for him.  We are asking for your help in anyway that you can by donating your money, time, or skills to help make this possible.

What We Need

  • Demolition of existing shower and tub, relocate electrical wiring, relocate plumping,  install ceramic shower with handicab rails,  install new toilet,  remove and replace vanity,  tear out floor and add extra support where needed, put in tile floor
  • Widen doorways in bedroom, bathroom and hallway, replace existing door knobs with lever door knobs
  • Total budget needed: $12,000

The Impact

As you give, no matter how small, you play an important part in making it possible for him to enjoy his life to the fullest and keep his independence while keeping him safe in his home with his family

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who can not contribute financially, does not mean you can’t help:

  • If you are a plumber, electrician or work in construction or do drywall...we can use your help!
  • Please spread the word however you can to help our cause.

story:
EN/DE/FR

Short description

Hello My name is Michel. I am 22 years old and I am a big fan of action sports. Since I'm definetly not the only one I had in mind to built an action sport center. We will offer several activities which are partly unknown and therefore not quite commun or not even represented on this continent. And this is why I'm writing to you. Me and my team's plans could be results-producing if you would agree on an for you appropiate support. Support us financially and/or support us by talking about our plans.


Kurzbeschreibung

Hallo Mein Name ist Michel. Ich bin 22 Jahre alt und ein großer Fan von Action Sports. Da ich mit Sicherheit nicht der Einzige bin, habe ich mir vorgenommen ein Action Sport center zu erbauen in dem wir sportliche Akivitäten anbieten, die teilweise noch relativ unbekannt und daher noch nicht weit verbeitet sind oder sogar auf diesem Kontinent noch nicht vertreten sind. Und da kommen Sie ins Spiel! Mit einer für sie angemessenen Unterstützung helfen sie mir und meinem Team unsere Pläne so effetkiv wie möglich zu verwirklichen. Unterstützen sie und finanziell und/oder indem sie von unserern Plänen sprechen! 

Die Hauptattraktion wird ein Windkanal zum Indoor Skydiving sein. Nach unseren Möglichkeiten versuchen wir den höchsten Windkanal Europas mit 32 Metern zu erbauen. Um den Effekt des effektiven freien Falls zu verstärken ist geplant einen großen Teil des Windkanals mit Glaswänden auszustatten.

Ein Großteil der Halle wird zu einem 4500 m² großem Trampolinpark, wie es bisher nur in den USA gibt. Besonderheit ist u.A. die geplante Schaumstoffgrube.

Der weitere Teil der Halle wird ein ca. 4500 m² großer Skatepark speziell für Skateboarder, BMX-Fahrer, Inline-Skater, Streetboarder und auf Anfrage sogar Trial-Fahrer. Der geplante Skatepark umfasst u.A. eine Schaumstoffgrube und ein Bigairbag.

Die Gesamtkosten belaufen sich auf ca. 9.760.514 €.

Mit diesen Attraktionen und Ihrer Unterstützung werden wir es schaffen, Sportliche Freizeitbeschäftigungen anzubieten die sehr viel Spaß machen, gesund für Körper und Geist sind; und das für Jung und Alt!



 Bref explication

Comme je suis surement pas le seule, je me suis dit de construire un centre ou l'on peut pratiquer des sports d'actions dans lequel on propose plusieurs activités sportives qui sont encore relativement inconnue et donc pas beaucoup rependu et même pas encore représentés sur ce continent. Et c'est à ce moment que vous entrez en jeu. Avec un soutien qui vous convient vous nous aidez, moi et mon team de réaliser nos plans au plus concrèt. Soutenez nous financiellement et/ou soutenez nous en parlent de nos plan. Merci pour votre soutien!

story:
Let me introduce myself.

Ayo, my name is Tuk Esjay Gordon. I live in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. I am half Inuit, and was born in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. I am 23 years old, and I started my physical transition on November 12th 2012, and I am finally starting to feel at home in my own body.

I am here to ask for help, which I don't do often. Us Gordon's are stubborn. I am here to open up the floor to donations for my top surgery fund, I thought I could do it all on my own but I unfortunately cannot.

Any cent, whatever is donated, 100% of the proceeds will go to my top surgery I'm hoping to book with Dr. McLean in Mississauga, Ontario within the next year.

My Budget

I need at least $7000 for the surgery itself, not including any expenses while out of province. I work two jobs and have managed to save $2000 on my own. I have set a realistic goal of $3000, and will continue to work and save while publishing My Transition Story to sell. Whatever funds raised, whether I reach my goal or not, will go directly towards my surgery fund.

The Transition Story I am currently working on to sell for $20 a copy, mostly to people I know in person, will also be mailed to anyone that chooses to donate to this campaign. Between this page and My Story I am aiming to book a surgery date for the end of summer, or Christmas break!

YOUR Impact

To sum up what I wrote in my Transition Story, any donations made, will go towards something I've dreamed of for my entire life. I have become this confident guy I never thought existed. I have come a long way, and finally have this drive and motivation in my life to do more, and to help others. But before I can do that, I need this surgery to improve my quality of life.

You will be giving me the confidence I need to move forward in life and to accomplish all of these things I have set out to do. I can't express enough how much any cent or dollar will help.

Alternatives

Life is one tough cookie, we can all vouche for that. All donations are welcomed and are greatly appreciated! If, for whatever reason, you can't donate I completely understand, no hard feelings! Feel free to share and get the word out.

story:
So what's happening?

We are a small team with a big goal: to be a world leader in quality natural medicines, and to help improve the quality of life for thousands of people around the world. There are many great causes out there, and we'd like to help as many people as we can. The best way we can do that is by doing what we do best, making natural medicines. For those underprivileged who cannot afford medical treatment, we will donate our medicines to World Health organisations, which they will then distribute to those who need them.

To do this we need to produce the best natural medicines available, and lots of it! We have been operating as a small boutique manufacturer for the past 3 years making herbal products in the spagyric tradition - an alchemical method of which the end result is a potent, exalted herbal medicine that stays true to the integrity of the plant.

Spagyrics are very different from other herbal medicines - they are the only 'complete' natural medicine as they contain all of the active elements from the plant in perfect balance and harmony, including the essential oils, tincture and mineral salts. Most other natural medicines only contain one of these elements. Because of their potent nature, Spagyrics dosages are lower than regular tinctures, extracts or dried herbs and far more effective. They do not simply mask or cover up symptoms, but instead heal from all levels of being simultaneously - body, mind and spirit.

We have a patent (pending) for a new extraction technique we call the vacuum circulation extraction method that allows us to optimally extract the essential oils and tincture from the herb at super low temperatures without compromising the delicate active ingredients. These components are further purified while the mineral salts are harvested and crystallised, then added back to the refined tincture and oils for further circulation and purification. The result is an exalted natural medicine, in perfect balance and harmony the way nature intended, with outstandingly high levels of purity and potency. Hence, the best natural medicine in the world!

Our team is made up of Phoenix Aquila, an internationally recognised alchemist & teacher of alchemy, and Kylie Aquila, creative director & designer. We also have in our circle of professionals, medical herbalists, classical homeopaths and Doctors.

We need another $100,000 funding to bridge the gap between fitting out our factory and being paid for our first large scale order. The operation will be fully self sustainable after the 3 months of production. To set up and keep it running (and us fed!) we need equipment, packaging, licenses, ongoing marketing - and some helping hands - to convert our new warehouse into a large scale laboratory.

If we receive our goal of $100,000 we can:
  1.  Fit out our factory with equipment:  We have grown out of our 'mini factory' at our home, and have moved our operations to a new warehouse 15 mins away. The lease is signed and we have moved in with our existing small scale lab, but to really get the production rolling and achieve our dream, we need more state of the art lab equipment, bottling and labeling machines, refrigeration, flooring and a sterile temperature controlled room. Our initial goal is to produce over 100 unique spagyric medicines and formulas for both retail outlets and qualified practitioners.
  2. Hire full time local staff: For day to day running of the factory and basic operations, filling orders, and helping with the numerous processes running simultaneously. Also allows for a professional cleaner once a week.
  3. Create packaging for all the products: Design is taken care of in-house, but we need someone to print it.
  4. Buy the raw materials: Herbs! We only use the finest quality organic ingredients, sourced from the best farmers around the world, and they need to be ordered in bulk.
  5. Pay the utilities: Power, water and phone/internet. A necessary expense. We support Origin Green Power now, but would love to have our operation run totally on solar one day.

We already have large orders ready to fill of our current brand of spagyrics, Celestial Alchemy, as well as a brand new independent range for an expanding international franchise. If we don't reach our financial goal we can still use the funds to produce a smaller output to begin with. Whatever you donate we will be able to use.


We LOVE our local area and want to keep our business here to help grow the community.

We are blessed to live in a very special part of the world. Uki is set in the heart of the Caldera, in Northern New South Wales, and is a sacred place of healing and transformation. It is the perfect place for the creation of revolutionary and transformative natural medicines, as the energy here is of a very high vibration.

The bigger picture…
To us, vision is all important in business and in life. Consistently in our personal and business lives we have experienced the energy created when goals and aims are clear and true to our heart's desires. Our vision is to be a world leader in natural medicine, and spagyrics are the future of natural medicine. Part of our vision is changing society's perception of natural medicine from being an alternative, to being a primary choice - and offering a powerful natural product as a first step in creating a holistic society once again. We are also very committed to help provide free health care to those in need. This is the beginning of a world wide project!

Can't make a financial donation?
Are you strapped for cash but want to be a part of our vision? There are other things you can do that are just as valuable to us:
  • Please share this campaign wherever you can: Facebook, twitter, email – the more shares, likes and chatter about our cause, the more energy will be generated. Indiegogo has a variety of share tools located underneath our banner.
  • If you have tried our Celestial Alchemy products in the past, please send in your feedback to info@celestial-alchemy.com
  • If you are in the media with an interest in alternative health, please contact us for interviews and more information.
  • If you are in the area of biomedical research, we would like your assistance in the testing of our products for research and development purposes.

An image of our current Celestial Alchemy range: We have worked very hard for the past few years to develop our beautiful range and now it is time to expand. :)

Would you like to know more about our Work?
To avoid bombarding you with information on a huge subject we have kept this information fairly brief, but here is a further description and a link to our website. For more information, please visit www.celestial-alchemy.com/spagyrics.

Be the Change...

Transform yourself, transform the world!

story:
The Rocky Mountain House Air Show has grown into a success story the whole town can be proud of. We started our first year Air Show with a modest budget, and few resources. Over the past decade the Air Show Society has made the show a success, by bringing us such acts as the Snowbirds, the Skyhawks, the CF-18 Demo Team, & local and international Air Show celebrities. We want to help celebrate the 100th anniversary for the town of Rocky and make this our best show yet.
 
      Proceeds from ticket & gate sales contribute to only approx 40% of the overall budget for the show. Without the support of businesses and fund-raising efforts of the society and the volunteers the show could not happen. We want to bring top notch performers to the show and keep the show sustainable. This campaign is to help fund the show and bring Pete Mcleod from Red Bull. In 2009, Pete McLeod of Red Lake, Ontario made history by becoming the youngest pilot and first Canadian to compete in the elite Red Bull Air Race World Championship. And Kent Pietsch from Jelly Belly ( comedy act ). These two performers are exciting to watch, and will help take the airshow to another level.
 
In the past we have relied on local business to support the show. This shout-out to the community will make a big difference in our ability to bring performers such as these to Rocky.
 
Our goal of $15,000 will help fund bring these performers to Rocky, and help contribute to the sustainability of the show for the future. Costs covered by your contribution will go towards travel expenses to get the pilots to our show, and cover their costs. If we do not reach our $15,000 goal the money raised will be put towards bringing who we can afford, and towards guarantee the future of the show.
 
Perks
10-49 - Mention on the website 
50-99 - 1 General Admission ticket, website
100-199 - T-shirt and 1 General Ticket, website
199-499 - 2-Tshirts, 2 General Tickets, 1 Parking pass, website
500 - Above  2 Flight Deck tickets ( Preferred Seating ), 2 T-shirts - 1 Parking Pass, website
 
The Impact
The Airshow impacts the entire Rocky Mountain House area by brining people to the show from all over the province, and It showcases the Rocky Airport to the community. In the past the show has had attendance in excess of the population of Rocky. We involve other community groups as well as volunteers and they benefit from being involved.This show impacts the local economy, but more importantly it exposes new generations to aviation and inspires dreams. It gives families an affordable way to attend an airshow that may not be able to to travel to others. It gives people a chance to see our proud Canadian Military, and their capabilities. It gives everyone a chance to be part of something special that will create memories that last a life time.
 
For people who can not contribute, you can help us by spreading the word about this campaign through social media, like us on facebook and share our story.

story:
This is my friend Billy, who is seriously the sweetest person ever. Last night, their bike was stolen on Bushwick Ave. This bike was Billy's livelihood! They are a bike messenger, and can't work without a bike! Also, biking makes them a happier person. They were still in the process of paying of this bike, and are unable to buy a new one because of this. (This bike was brand new people!) 

 

Could you pass them a few bucks and help them out?

story:
DryBath can be used to clean skin without bathing/showering. 

It's just as great to use after a normal shower, removing full-body odor & the need for twice-daily showers by keeping you fresher for longer.

_________________

As seen on: 

  • TED.com: http://on.ted.com/e0Hd6 
  • TIME Magazine:  http://goo.gl/mEebn0     OR http://goo.gl/UqeX2O 
  • CNN: http://goo.gl/NyyeLX


The showers & baths we love taking daily often leads to dry skin, and the time needed to do these body-cleaning rituals becomes less & less as our schedules  get busier. We're cleaning our skins with strong soaps & scrubs  that damage our skin's protective layer by drying it out, especially when bathing twice a day or with antibacterial soaps. 

The germicidal foam often isn’t on the skin long enough to be effective, and ironically, that same foam ends up also killing the “good germs” that the skin needs to stay healthy.

  • You're welcome to click the links below the “References” heading (at the bottom of the campaign page) to find out more about how bathing works & the science behind it.



This is where DryBath comes in...


  1. The DryBath Gel cleans your body by using the skin-rubbing motion of your hands to gently remove dead skin cells, without damaging your skin's natural protective barrier
  2. Because DryBath lowers the need for water, you can then simply use a damp cloth to wipe off any visible dirt you see, before letting the skin dry with no need for added lotion to moisturize.
  3. The formula eliminates full-body odor while keeping your skin smelling & feeling fresh for longer. It provides a quick-fun & effective body clean, with no mess!


The truth is, besides germs on your hands, your typical urban lifestyle doesn’t cause your skin to get dirty enough to require daily soaping & scrubbing.


Gently wiping your body with a damp cloth every day is all you need to clean any “dirt” (dead skin cells) on your skin, but sadly that doesn’t help much with regard to naturally removing full-body odor so that you can confidently tackle your day.


Our DryBath Gel replaces the need for water, soap, & moisturizer.  One 15ml EasySnap sachet is enough to clean 1 full avg. human body, and our active essential oils & Tawas odour-eliminator have a natural effect on the skin. 



Although DryBath doesn't provide the same immersion & hydrotherapy as bathing with water, it does a great job of cleaning the skin. The formula uses natural active ingredients to clean the skin, without wasting time, soap & water down the drain.



Your pledge enables you to try our innovative DryBath Gel at (cost+shipping), and you also get one of our cool hand-made DryBather bracelets, giving you bragging rights as a #DryBather pioneer who supports water conservation.



Reformulated to suit your urban #DryBathMoments

Your pledge to the NoBathing Weekend gives you an opportunity to try the latest version of the DryBath Gel. This new formula is specially made to help you during the #DryBathMoments that urban lifestyles can throw your way. 

Some of these examples might resonate with you:

  1. Running late for work or school in the morning
  2. Avoiding dirty shared showers or bathtubs at your flat/work/school/gym
  3. Cleaning yourself after a run if your office has no showers
  4. Situations with low-water availability (camping, long-distance travel, rural communities,  etc)
  5. When bathing with water is simply inconvenient or awkward 

Feel free to tweet pictures of these & more  #DryBathMoments that DryBath helps you overcome.





Sounds great? 

Then let’s use it to create the biggest annual water conservation campaign!

Not only do our methods of cleaning our bodies waste about 40-80 litres (11-22 gallons) of water, they are also not ideal to use in situations when water & time are a limited resource. 

This often guilts us into feeling dirty when we can’t have a full water bathe, even though we don’t really need one. So with that in mind, we’re using the annual campaign to build a home for people to join our community of DryBathers. Your pledge will save up to 160 litres of water, and you'll have DryBath Gel for when you need to clean yourself quickly without any mess.


By pledging to participate in the NoBathing Weekend, you will be part of the group that pioneers how people will clean themselves in the future. You also play a pivotal role in helping our team to grow this campaign into the biggest annual water conservation collaboration in the world. Think “the water version of Earth Hour”, except the world doesn’t have to come to a standstill.


The Inventor's Annual Pledge

  1. If we get 1 000 pledges, I will not bathe for a week.

  2. If we get 100k pledges, I will not bathe for a month.



Pledging & Perks (Delivered to you by 25 September)

  • DryBather hand-made Bracelet: You can pledge to receive one of our cool DryBather bracelets, and participate by skipping a bath/shower or cleaning yourself only with a damp cloth. The bracelet designs are being finalized & are made by artisans from rural areas.

  • DryBath Gel Sample Packs: If you’re worried that a damp cloth won’t be enough to rid your body odor, then you can pledge for one of the sample perks that provide you with DryBath Gel to eliminate odor with. Each 15ml Snap&Squeeze sachet is enough to clean the average-sized human body, and it replaces 1 bathe/shower.

#DryBathMoments: We're confident that you’ll love our DryBath Gel, and that you’ll use the extra supply when you experience the #DryBathMoments that life often throws at all of us. 


All pledgers will have their bracelets delivered by Thursday 25 September 2014. The pledge amounts include a global delivery charge of $10-20, depending on size of pledge.



Ok I’m in. What else can I do?

The #NoBathing Weekend Campaign also provides a fun opportunity for you to find and share a few water-related facts.

Check out what you could do with the water you save by skipping ONE bathe (80 litres avg):

  • Drink 2 litres per day for 1.5 months

  • Brush your teeth twice a day for 2 months

  • Flush the toilet 16 (everyday for half a month?)

  • Wash the dishes for half the month


  • TWEET (https://twitter.com/HeadboyLTD )

Please feel free to tweet @HeadboyLTD with other cool things you can think of doing with the water you’re saving, and share cool pictures of your #NoBathing or #DryBathMoments!


  • FACEBOOK EVENT RSVP

Even if you can’t make a pledge on our Indiegogo page (http://igg.me/at/DryBath2014), feel free to show your support by RSVPing to the #NoBathing Weekend Campaign event on Facebook (http://goo.gl/3l8uqk).


Remember to share the experience with your friends & family, you might just change the way they stay clean & amplify your water impact!




Media Coverage & More information about DryBath

  • TED Talk: http://on.ted.com/e0Hd6 
  • TIME Magazine:  http://goo.gl/mEebn0     - http://goo.gl/UqeX2O 
  • CNN: http://goo.gl/NyyeLX 
  • MTV Base Leadership Award Nomination: http://goo.gl/3wI9PD 
  • RedBull Amaphiko: http://goo.gl/xdR2IE 
  • Engineering.com : http://goo.gl/6Vzv4K 
  • Forbes: http://goo.gl/WIIExJ 
  • Huffington Post: http://goo.gl/fm96VB 
  • Al Jazeera English: http://goo.gl/k4h951 
  • Gizmodo : http://goo.gl/Ap2qvY (old original germicidal-version)
  • DryBath product webpage: https://www.headboy.org/drybath/ 


REFERENCES

Click the links below to read more about bathing & the fact that skin cleaning only requires an effective odour-removing moisturiser to repair the damage caused by chlorinated tap water:

  • HowStuffWorks- http://goo.gl/OVlqCn

  • New York Times- http://goo.gl/3OtGBo

  • History of bathing- http://goo.gl/ZhP3v      - http://goo.gl/nt2PLn
story_txt:
DryBath can be used to clean skin without bathing/showering. 

It's just as great to use after a normal shower, removing full-body odor & the need for twice-daily showers by keeping you fresher for longer.


_________________

As seen on: 


TED.com: http://on.ted.com/e0Hd6 
TIME Magazine:  http://goo.gl/mEebn0     OR http://goo.gl/UqeX2O 
CNN: http://goo.gl/NyyeLX




The showers & baths we love taking daily often leads to dry skin, and the time needed to do these body-cleaning rituals becomes less & less as our schedules  get busier. We're cleaning our skins with strong soaps & scrubs  that damage our skin's protective layer by drying it out, especially when bathing twice a day or with antibacterial soaps. The germicidal foam often isn’t on the skin long enough to be effective, and ironically, that same foam ends up also killing the “good germs” that the skin needs to stay healthy.You're welcome to click the links below the “References” heading (at the bottom of the campaign page) to find out more about how bathing works & the science behind it.



This is where DryBath comes in...

The DryBath Gel cleans your body by using the skin-rubbing motion of your hands to gently remove dead skin cells, without damaging your skin's natural protective barrier
Because DryBath lowers the need for water, you can then simply use a damp cloth to wipe off any visible dirt you see, before letting the skin dry with no need for added lotion to moisturize.
The formula eliminates full-body odor while keeping your skin smelling & feeling fresh for longer. It provides a quick-fun & effective body clean, with no mess!
The truth is, besides germs on your hands, your typical urban lifestyle doesn’t cause your skin to get dirty enough to require daily soaping & scrubbing.Gently wiping your body with a damp cloth every day is all you need to clean any “dirt” (dead skin cells) on your skin, but sadly that doesn’t help much with regard to naturally removing full-body odor so that you can confidently tackle your day.
Our DryBath Gel replaces the need for water, soap, & moisturizer.  One 15ml EasySnap sachet is enough to clean 1 full avg. human body, and our active essential oils & Tawas odour-eliminator have a natural effect on the skin. 
Although DryBath doesn't provide the same immersion & hydrotherapy as bathing with water, it does a great job of cleaning the skin. The formula uses natural active ingredients to clean the skin, without wasting time, soap & water down the drain.Your pledge enables you to try our innovative DryBath Gel at (cost+shipping), and you also get one of our cool hand-made DryBather bracelets, giving you bragging rights as a #DryBather pioneer who supports water conservation.Reformulated to suit your urban #DryBathMomentsYour pledge to the NoBathing Weekend gives you an opportunity to try the latest version of the DryBath Gel. story:
My friend Jim Rizzo D.C. has traveled around the world volunteering medically to improve the lives of others in Croatia and Haiti.  I have known Jim over 25 years and this is my first time to travel with him.  Jim is a Chiropractor and I am an Registered Nurse.  We are fundraising to raise funds for the Mercy of Mission that we are traveling to support and to cover our travel expenses.  Our goal is $2,000 to cover our travel expenses and donations to the Mercy of Mission and a children's orphanage in Port au Prince. 

In preparing for this trip I read the book "Because We Are" a novel by Ted Oswald.  It was an inspiring and intriguing read and I highly recommend it.  All royalties from the book are donated to development and advocacy organizations in Haiti.

story:
Short Summary

The Trager® Approach has helped thousands of people around the world over the past 80 years, yet it is still relatively unknown.   We, the United States Trager Association board of directors, and other Trager practitioners all over the globe, are passionate about this work, and we would like to see it thrive in the 21st century and beyond. 

 Our hope is for everyone to experience something beyond relaxation, to experience peace in their bodies, and, by extension, to experience peace in the greater world…… where many have forgotten what peace feels like.

In order for this to happen, Trager needs to become a familiar concept like Pilates, Yoga, Tai Chi, and Therapeutic Massage, and people need to be able to easily find a practitioner.


WE NEED YOU!


 The US Trager® Association website (www.tragerus.org) is outdated; our ‘Find a Practitioner’ tab does not work on mobile devices used by most people in the world today; and, the language the website is written in is no longer being supported.   This means we need to have the entire website rewritten.

We need to address our website issues now so that the many people who could benefit from this work can easily find out about the Trager Approach, find practitioners near them, and learn about our training programs and educational materials.   Unfortunately, we do not have the extra funds to implement all the needed changes to our website at this time.

We are asking for $9,000 to fully cover all costs.

  • $5,000 – Website rewrite and redesign:

    1.   Including compatability with mobile devices,                       
    2.   fixing our 'Find a Practitioner' link,                       
    3.   making our website more visible for searches from people with conditions that can be helped by Trager work, and                      
    4.   adding interactive forms for purchasing educational material.
  • $1,000/year – technical support and staff training
  • $3,000 – for general operating expenses that will give us the reserves needed    to be pro-active in meeting the needs of our members and the world wide community in the future.


 Our larger mission is to educate the public about how Trager can help all of us lead more productive, happier, and freer lives.  So please circulate this campaign as widely as you can.  Pass it along to people you think might benefit from a session, or who might be interested in learning more about Trager.   Please post a link to our campaign on the social media sites you frequent and let other groups you belong to know about us as well.


What is Trager®?

  In the 20th century, Milton Trager MD, developed a unique approach to self-awareness through movement that improved balance and mobility and reduced restricted movement.  Dr. Trager realized that for every holding pattern in the physical body there is a corresponding constriction in the subconscious mind.

Using gentle, non-intrusive, natural movements, the Trager®Approach helps bring into awareness deep-seated subconscious mental and physical patterns of movement that may no longer be beneficial.  These patterns can be replaced with movements that are easier, freer, and generally less painful, less restrictive. This leads to deep relaxation, fosters mental clarity, and increases mobility. Dr. Trager helped post-polio patients walk again and helped those with Parkinson’s syndrome, Multiple Sclerosis, and other neurological problems retain or relearn functional movements that allowed them to remain actively engaged for longer than was thought possible by the medical establishment of the time. 

When he started teaching his approach to others in 1976, Dr. Trager had already been refining and developing his work for nearly 50 years.  The Trager Approach is now taught and practiced in more than thirteen (13) countries and has helped a wide range of people:  from autistic children to adults with chronic back pain; from people with frozen shoulders to those with temporal mandibular joint problems (TMJ); from veterans with post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) to those with depression or eating disorders. 

The Trager Approach brings your mind and body into better connection within the present moment through a semi-meditative state that Dr. Trager called ‘Hook Up’.  It is a feeling state akin to what you experience when you see a beautiful sunset or rainbow or a newborn baby. It is a feeling of being connected to everything around you. 

In a Trager session you ‘catch’ this feeling from a certified Trager practitioner and you are given additional movements that you can work and play with on your own.  The recall of the Trager experience, together with these self-help movements (called Mentastics® for mental gymnastics), assist you in returning to this state of peace and freer, easier movement.  Below are 3 videos made by various Trager practitioners showing different aspects of the work.  They range in length from about 3 minutes to 15 minutes.





Special Invitation!

 If you have received any benefits from your experience of Trager  work, or have a loved one who has received the benefits of Trager sessions, we invite you to make a short video (cell phone quality is fine) 1 - 2 minutes long about why you tried Trager and how it has specifically helped you, and send it to tragerindiegogo@gmail.com

We’ll post your video to this campaign, and to the new US Trager Association website when it goes live.  This additional information from you could be a great educational tool for everyone. 

But, if the thought of making a video sends you running for the hills, or you just don't have the time or equipment to make one, please consider sending us a paragraph or two with your story at the tragerindiegogo@gmail.com. Or consider writing your story in the comment section above.  Let those with similar problems know there is an innovative way to change their lives for the better.  

Funding

We are using flexible funding for this campaign so that any money we do raise will go towards our goal of making the best possible website we can.  Any money raised over our goal, will go both towards adding more functionality to our website (for example: better ability to find a practitioner within a given distance) and to help us spread knowledge of Trager® and Mentastics® as far as possible. Part of our vision is to attract and support more students, practitioners, tutors, class organizers, and instructors; so that when someone wants or needs a Trager® session, there will be a certified Trager  practitioner nearby.   Please give generously so we can help everyone become more aware of their bodies; help them move more easily throughout their lives; and help them learn how to release old patterns so they can lead freer, more dynamic lives, with less pain and restriction.  Help us bring Peace, one body at a time.

    How you can contribute.

    Even if you are unable to contribute to our campaign at the present time, there are other actions that would greatly aid us in making the Trager Approach known to a much wider audience.  If you can afford even $1, that would be great, but more importantly, please share our campaign with your family, friends, colleagues, social  networks, book clubs, with as many people as you can.  We want more people to learn how Trager® can help them.   Please send them to our campaign link:

    http://igg.me/at/tragerus2014,  or to the www.indiegogo.com website and have them search for Trager .  

    If you know anyone who has chronic pain, restricted movement,  neurological problems, or is in a stressful situation, let them know that they can find more information about Trager at the United States Trager®Association website: www.tragerus.org. 

    If you shop on Amazon you can also help us by using the Amazon link on the www.tragerus.org website.  The link takes you through to your usual Amazon experience and the prices you pay are the same, but we receive a small percentage of Amazon's share of whatever you buy.

    And last, but not least, find a Certified Trager  practitioner and get a session; so you will understand why we all rave about this work and have dedicated our lives to keeping it alive.


    Internationally

    To find information about Trager® in other languages, go to the Trager® International website at  www.trager.com . It  has information in 10 different languages. Trager International is currently composed of 12 national Trager associations representing more than 20 countries.

    The  International organization trains, certifies and supports Trager® practitioners around the world.

    The Trager International web site includes:

    • links to all the national associations
    • where to find practitioners throughout the represented countries
    • the history of Milton Trager, MD and the organization
    • description and applications of the Trager® Approach
    • the professional training program
    • world wide schedule of training

    PERKS

    We do have some very interesting perks for you when you do donate to this campaign.  Depending on the level at which you donate you'll get one or more of the perks shown below.

    The Essence Journal Notebook

    6 3/4 X 5 3/4 Hard cover, spiral bound with velcro closure. Trager® logo, address, current website and phone number on the cover.

    A Question of Ease

       
      A page from A Question of Ease

        Mentastics® with Milton (DVD)- In this video Dr. Trager discusses, teaches and demonstrates Mentastics® with a group of Practitioners. Approx. 1 hr long

        Parkinson DVD Made in 1986 32 minutes long

        Some examples of the one of a kind clay and bead necklaces are below.   They have the 'Dancing Cloud®' logo on one side and a Tragerish saying on the back.




        Silver 'Dancing Cloud®' pendant made by Gusterman Silversmiths in Colorado



        National Conference 2015

        Movement, Meditation and Medicine

        USTA National/International

        Events October 3-6, 2015

        PEARLSTONE CONFERENCE AND RETREAT CENTER

If you shop on Amazon you can also help us by using the Amazon link on the www.tragerus.org website.  The link takes you through to your usual Amazon experience and the prices you pay are the same, but we receive a small percentage of Amazon's share of whatever you buy.
And last, but not least, find a Certified Trager  practitioner and get a session; so you will understand why we all rave about this work and have dedicated our lives to keeping it alive.

Internationally
To find information about Trager® in other languages, go to the Trager® International website at  www.trager.com . It  has information in 10 different languages. Trager International is currently composed of 12 national Trager associations representing more than 20 countries.


The  International organization trains, certifies and supports Trager® practitioners around the world.
The Trager International web site includes:

links to all the national associations
where to find practitioners throughout the represented countries

the history of Milton Trager, MD and the organization
description and applications of the Trager® Approach

the professional training program 
world wide schedule of training

  

PERKS
We do have some very interesting perks for you when you do donate to this campaign.  Depending on the level at which you donate you'll get one or more of the perks shown below.

The Essence Journal Notebook 
6 3/4 X 5 3/4 Hard cover, spiral bound with velcro closure. Trager® logo, address, current website and phone number on the cover.


A Question of Ease 
 
  A page from A Question of Ease
Mentastics® with Milton (DVD)- In this video Dr. Trager discusses, teaches and demonstrates Mentastics® with a group of Practitioners. Approx. 1 hr longParkinson DVD Made in 1986 32 minutes longSome examples of the one of a kind clay and bead necklaces are below.   They have the 'Dancing Cloud®' logo on one side and a Tragerish saying on the back. Silver 'Dancing Cloud®' pendant made by Gusterman Silversmiths in ColoradoNational Conference 2015Movement, Meditation and Medicine
USTA National/International
Events October 3-6, 2015

PEARLSTONE CONFERENCE AND RETREAT CENTER

story:
*Note: The campaign is now flexible funding, and not "All or Nothing" funding.

Who Am I & What Is This About?

     Greetings! My name is Sebastian Elcano. I'm a waiter, a music producer, and an aspiring yogi, but first and foremost, I am a human being. I am a human being who seeks to realize the depths of who I am, in order to serve humanity to my absolute FULLEST capacity during my lifetime.

     There seem to be many pathways toward self-empowerment, however the path that pulls me the strongest is that of the yogi. As I understand it, yoga has been practiced for thousands of years as a concrete method to know the self in the deepest possible way. It is for this reason that I have decided to commit myself to a five month long, Hatha Yoga Teacher Training Program through the Isha Foundation.  The program will take place at the Isha Headquarters, nestled at the foothills of the Velliangiri Mountains in Southern India.  These mystical mountains have been witness to countless sages, and enlightened beings throughout India's history. 

      The type of yoga I will be learning, Hatha yoga, is specifically designed to make the human body into a stepping stone toward what lies beyond the physical reality. I will be practicing yoga and meditation for seven hours a day, and learning about various other aspects of yoga for 2-3 hours a day as well. This is a no-nonsense, fully immersive program that will whip me into the best mental/physical shape of my life, and simultaneously serve as a powerful means to know myself. 

     I seek to know myself, to embody my highest potential at all times. I seek to know myself, to know all of creation. I seek to know myself, to become the ultimate servant for the world. However, as passionate as I am about this Hatha Yoga Teacher Training Program, it will not become a reality unless I can raise sufficient funds for it. This is why I come to you today, humbly asking for your support in my mission to become a fully empowered servant of the earth.

What I Need & What You Get!

     I need to raise $10,000 to make this dream of mine turn into reality! This is the total cost of the program, which includes tuition, accommodations, and food for the entire length of my stay.  I have enough saved up to purchase my plane ticket, but I still need to cover the cost of the program itself.  I need as much support from my human family as possible in this crucial hour of my life journey!  

     Out of the gratitude I harbor for your willingness to help this cause in whatever way you can, I have created a series of heartfelt  'perks' to offer you in exchange for your generous contributions!!  I thought about what I could lovingly offer you with my skills and abilities, and I came up with the list of perks you see to the right of this text.  I am excited to give away my time, artistic creativity, musical ability, and love in exchange for your support!!!

 

The Impact

     Mother earth desperately needs more fully empowered human beings who take responsibility for our role as stewards of the earth. Humanity desperately needs more human beings who lead with LOVE in all their endeavors. Any one of us is capable of becoming empowered, and many of us already are, but there must be a tremendous willingness within to make it happen. As far as I can tell, no other factor is more important on the journey toward self empowerment than willingness itself. Everything else is secondary. I have good news for you all.... I AM WILLING!!!!!  The most important piece is already in place! I have surrendered myself completely to the cause of becoming the greatest human being I can become, in order to serve humanity to my fullest. Yoga is the way i have chosen to accomplish this.  This is my purpose. This is my path. All I need now, is YOUR SUPPORT to make this a reality!

     All global change starts on the individual scale. By investing in my training as a yogi, you are DIRECTLY investing in the future of humanity and the world.  I humbly ask you to contribute to my campaign today, not for me, but for the infinite love I will provide for the world, throughout the course of my lifetime. Thank you so much for your support!! It quite literally means the world to me. :)

Other Ways You Can Help

     If you are not in a place to contribute financially, that's ok!! There are other ways you can help this cause. Share my Indiegogo Campaign with friends on your social networks, email friends and family about it, or spread the news by word of mouth. If you are involved with or know of a business/community that you think would be particularly resonant with my campaign, please contact me with info at dselcano@yahoo.com. Thank you for your willingness to help in any way you can.
