story:
Short Summary

Mavis was diagnosed with stage 4 breast cancer in 2009.  She has had surgery and 75 chemo treatments so far.  She has chemo treatments three weeks per month with no end in sight.  She has tons of medical bills and is not finding assistance through the foundations. 

What We Need & What You Get

The money you donate will be going directly to Marshfield Clinic to ease the burden. 

The Impact

Fighting cancer takes a lot of strength...It would be a lot less stressful not having the clinic hounding for higher payments all the time.  She could focus on staying healthy and fighting the cancer instead of worrying where the next payment will come from.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.  PLEASE pass my story along to those you know.  Help me make some noise about my campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!

Prayers are also needed and greatly appreciated!

story:
Karyna Santana, aka Emma X, is a beautiful, bright & creative Orlando musician, artist and much loved friend. On Sunday, February 3rd, Karyna Santana was critically injured and nearly killed when she collided with a Jeep while riding her bicycle home from work. She must now brave a long and arduous recovery as a result of her severe facial injuries, the likes of which doctors have expressed surprise at her surviving at all.

Karyna is well known for being a strong, beautiful and athletic woman who enjoys a challenge and making people laugh. Her strength never doubted, it has unfortunately been overwhelmingly put to the test now as she confronts extensive reconstruction, medical attention, therapy and much courage on her part.

Please donate to ease Karyna's long path towards recovery and a healthy, happy new life!

story:
BE A HERO AND HELP A LITTLE BOY CONQUER LIFE-THREATENING ASTHMA!

My name is Sara Smith and I am from Lubbock, Texas. I would like to take a minute and tell you about a friend and co-worker, Amber Cooper, and her precious little boy Rayden. 

8-year old Rayden was born 11 weeks premature and he suffers from severe, persistent, life-threatening asthma, which did not begin to surface until he was 6. He is unable to play sports or participate in normal outdoor activities because of his illness. This is what Rayden's mother had to say: "He has suffered severe depression because he can't take part in what his friends are doing. When Rayden was told that he was not going to get to play sports or participate in P.E. at school with his friends, it hit him really hard. At 6 years old, Rayden was put on Lexapro, a depression medication, because he was so angry about his health. He said that he wanted to die and that he wanted to jump in the street so a truck would hit him. That broke my heart. What hurt the most is when he looked in my eyes and asked why I even had him. I have never had a more helpless feeling."

In the last 6 months, Rayden has been hospitalized 3 times. The resources available in Lubbock are now exhausted, and his pulmonologist has decided that he needs to go to National Jewish Health in Denver, Colorado for proper treatment.

National Jewish Health is known worldwide for treatment of patients with respiratory, cardiac, immune and related disorders, and for groundbreaking medical research. Founded in 1899 as a nonprofit hospital, National Jewish Health remains the only facility in the world dedicated exclusively to these disorders. For the past 15 consecutive years, U.S. News & World Report has ranked National Jewish Health the #1 respiratory hospital in the nation.

Rayden's family needs funds for traveling and other expenses during the 10-14 days that they will need to be in Denver. Their doctor wants them to go in March 2013, but the trip itself is dependent on the family's financial situation. That's where you come in!    

Every donation will be greatly appreciated and will go towards getting this family to a place where they have the capabilities to help Rayden. He deserves to have a normal childhood. Donate today!

Many thanks and God Bless,

Sara Smith

story:
My name is Larry Strouse Jr.  I am 46 years old.  On April 20th of this year I was diagnosed with End Stage Liver Disease and Acute Pancreatitis with the possibility of a tumor on the my pancreas.

When I was released from the hospital in South Carolina I had to move into my parents house in Florida and be under HOSPICE CARE.  HOSPICE would come into the home once or twice a week to follow up with the care.

Because of all the medications I really could not do anything.  The pain at times would be excrutiating.

My last lab work just came back with some positive results and as of August 9th I will be released from HOSPICE CARE.  Unfortunatly I still do have Liver Disease and Pancreatitis.

I was Blessed to have HOSPICE helping me but now I am asking for some much needed assistance.  Since I still can't work or drive I am asking for your HELP.  Anything that you could do would be much appreciated.

Throughout this I did pick up a hobby of making jewelry out of hemp rope and beads.  I would like to offer the following as a small token of my appreciation.  For a $25 donation a hand crafted keychain.  $35 a bracelet, 50 a necklace and for 100 you would receive all 3 in matching designs.

All of your donations would go directly towards all doctor visits, medications and living expenses.  Hopefully  GOD willing one day I will be well enough to go back to work.

Even if you cannot spare anything I will gladly accept any and all prayers.

If you would like to write my e-mail is larrystrouse@yahoo.com

Thank You and God Bless

Larry Strouse Jr.

story:
Update 1: Special Superhero Perks!

We created for you some new special perks that will maybe entertain you a little bit;) You can obtain a digital edition of the first and only SurveyHero comics or a member card to SurveyHero Club. If you like our campaign, do not forget to share it through your social networks!


Surveys are everywhere around us, they help us achieve our goals, or they can entertain us, and indeed everyone can easily create them. Are you interested in going through something completely new? Try SurveyHero - dangerously powerful and the world's funniest online survey system.


Media that wrote about us


Story

SurveyHero is really for everyone. It can help students with their projects (or with organization a party), start-upers and small / medium-sized businesses achieve their business dreams. It's powerful enough for large companies, even for research agencies. We have created a comic story to continue and our own superhero who will accompany you through the entire creation of the survey. It provides interesting tips, tricks, methodological guidance and it will certainly often make you laugh ;). The main idea is that each of us can become real superhero in everyday life and does not need superhuman strength or iron suit - just follow your dreams and try to achieve your life or business goals. SurveyHero is the tool which will definitely help you with it. So what are you waiting for? Pick your perk and start your successful story!


How it Works


So powerful and at the same time so simple to use that even a child can have fun with it for example creating quizzes.

SurveyHero is optimized for each device. You can create an unlimited number of surveys, use unlimited number of questions (it includes 26 types of questions, all the basic ones plus special types such as A / B test, video, or MP3 question) and design survey templates in unlimited colour variations.


Try your first SurveyHero survey!

Share our Indiegogo campaign through social media networks (it's optional) and participate in the competition to win a T- shirt, a 16 GB USB key or a baseball cap.




Distribution methods

Distribution methods are the best part of SurveyHero and we paid special attention to them. SurveyHero will provide you with effective super powers to send out surveys.




Who is behind SurveyHero?

Our company Marketing & Netforce Ltd. has been providing comprehensive solutions in the field of KDD (Knowledge Discovery in Databases) and market research since 2011, while our specialization is research in the online environment and it is directly related to the creation of online surveys. More information can be found here: mnforce

We love our work and we want to be the best at it. Last year we decided to make a big step forward and share our dreams, our work and our passion with everybody. The creation of SurveyHero was the first impulse. Right now, we are starting beta testing after one year journey. SurveyHero is not just an idea in our minds, it is real, it works, and it can be yours in a few short months, in September 2015.

Crowdfunding sites are great places to create new products community. That is why we are on Indiegogo. We want to build up a community of people that like what we do, want to support SurveyHero and to be part of it.


Just one more step is waiting for us!

In September 2015 we will send you your license key by e-mail and the gift by post, based on your selected perk. 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Inspired robotics for better sports performance.

Vive Robotics Inc. is the name, next generation sports robotics is our game.

We are a team of seasoned entrepreneurs and talented engineers whose passion for AI solutions rivals that of athletes developing their craft. We've married these two worlds to develop the smallest, lightest and fastest AI-powered tennis ball retriever on the market.

Others have tried to develop similar solutions, but none have quite delivered. Our innovative and accessible solution allows everyone, everywhere to keep the rally going.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Get acquainted with your new [automated] ball boy.

 

 
 

How it Works

Simply put, here's how Vive Tennis works:

  • During a match, Vive stands by, waiting patiently next to the net
  • Vive uses its proprietary tracking technology to identify once a ball is no longer in play
  • Vive retrieves the ball and brings it back to you at the baseline

If you urgently need Vive to stop chasing the ball, use the accompanying wristband which has an instant shut-off option (wristband included with every Vive Tennis order).

 

The Specs + the Tech

We're using the most cutting-edge tech to create one insanely intelligent design. Here's the skinny on what we're cooking up.

 

More on our specs:

 

Milestones & Roadmap

 

The Funding

Here's how your funding is going to be used:

  • 70% will be used for Original Design Manufacturing
  • 30% will be used for marketing

 

The Perks

Vive Tennis early bird pricing: Be one of only 30 people to secure early-bird pricing on your very own Vive Tennis robot companion.

Retail price: $799 | Early bird price: $499

Vive Tennis Indiegogo special pricing: Enjoy 25% off the Vive Tennis retail price.

Retail price: $799 | Indiegogo special price: $599

Tennis Balls: Receive a 6-pack of branded tennis balls with an $18 backing amount.
story_txt:
Inspired robotics for better sports performance.
Vive Robotics Inc. is the name, next generation sports robotics is our game.
We are a team of seasoned entrepreneurs and talented engineers whose passion for AI solutions rivals that of athletes developing their craft. We've married these two worlds to develop the smallest, lightest and fastest AI-powered tennis ball retriever on the market.
Others have tried to develop similar solutions, but none have quite delivered. Our innovative and accessible solution allows everyone, everywhere to keep the rally going.

 
 
 
 

 
 
Get acquainted with your new [automated] ball boy.
 


 
 


How it Works
Simply put, here's how Vive Tennis works:

During a match, Vive stands by, waiting patiently next to the net
Vive uses its proprietary tracking technology to identify once a ball is no longer in play
Vive retrieves the ball and brings it back to you at the baseline

If you urgently need Vive to stop chasing the ball, use the accompanying wristband which has an instant shut-off option (wristband included with every Vive Tennis order).
 
The Specs + the Tech
We're using the most cutting-edge tech to create one insanely intelligent design. Here's the skinny on what we're cooking up.

 
More on our specs:

 
Milestones & Roadmap

 
The Funding
Here's how your funding is going to be used:

70% will be used for Original Design Manufacturing
30% will be used for marketing

 
The Perks
Vive Tennis early bird pricing: Be one of only 30 people to secure early-bird pricing on your very own Vive Tennis robot companion.
Retail price: $799 | Early bird price: $499
Vive Tennis Indiegogo special pricing: Enjoy 25% off the Vive Tennis retail price.
Retail price: $799 | Indiegogo special price: $599
Tennis Balls: Receive a 6-pack of branded tennis balls with an $18 backing amount.

story:
PSU Quidditch

Penn State Club Quidditch is in its third full year at Penn State University. We travel to tournaments in the Mid-Atlantic Region (http://www.internationalquidditch.org/teams/location/US/region/Mid-Atlantic) throughout the year, culminating in a World Cup in Kissimmee, Florida.


We have attended the regional tournament in Roanoke, Virginia, in which we placed 3rd and got a berth into the World Cup, resulting in a global rank of 17th. PSU Quidditch has also attended the Turtle Cup (Maryland), City of Brotherly Love Cup (Chestnut Hill College), World Cups IV and V, and its own Nittany Cup.

The World Cup comes with a cost though, which is where we ask your help. With contributions and donations of any size, we can ensure that the team members of PSU Quidditch will have an amazing time at the World Cup.

Funding Breakdown

Being an official club sport as of last year, we do get some school funding, but it is not nearly enough to cover costs. We also try to keep dues down so that non-tournament members can have fun too. The other costs come out of pocket.
 
Any help is great help in decreasing the costs of airfare, hotel stay, local transportation and sports equipment. And who knows, if we raise enough, maybe we can eat more than ramen noodles for a while!

The Impact

If you've ever been on a team or in a club, you understand our passion for our sport. You understand the drive we have for competing and proving ourselves to the other teams. And if you've ever been in college or provided for yourself, you understand the financial burden we are under. Quidditch isn't a part of everybody's budget, so every penny counts.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't spare any change, don't worry! Send this along to your friends, post it to Facebook or Twitter. Anyone you know that loves Penn State (or hates our rivals), or loves Harry Potter should be more than willing to help us out.
 
We also sell Club Quidditch Shirts, so inquire if you are interested!
 
Or come and support us in person at tournaments. Fans are always welcome!
 
Check out our gallery!
http://www.internationalquidditch.org

story:
We love to ride bicycles. We love the feeling of cool air rushing around us. We love the sun of open roads and the shade of woods. We love the freedom bicycles give us to go anywhere we want. It is all beautiful except for one minor thing – painful seating.

 

 

 

NAMO stands for natural motion and refers to the ability of the seat to follow the rider’s natural movements.

The fixed position of today’s bicycle seats is enough to cause major problems for bike riders. We all know what rigid seating can do to the most sensitive part of our bodies. Users of small size seats experience pain because of tissue compression and chafing that occurs when user's body rubs across the surface of the seat. The compression and subsequent friction of tissues between the seat and hip bones causes discomfort. In extreme cases it can even cause severe injuries.

On the other hand Namo Seat moves together with the rider. It works with the body and not against it. The rider does not have to overcome the resistance of the seat nor worry about pain caused by it. The seat moves in tandem with the rider, side to side, helping him efficiently transfer power from his legs to the pedals.

Drop down nose design and use of modern materials makes Namo Seat one of the best looking bicycle seats as well as one of the best performing. Thanks to patent pending technology the rider's movements are no longer restricted by a fixed seat. That one feature alone may result in energy savings and increase in bicycling efficiency. Over time this can result in higher overall performance.

 

Namo Seat works with you and not against you. It supports your body without restricting it. It is the only seat that can swing with you from left to right without forcing you to bend your spine unnaturally in the process. The below pictures show the seat swinging and rotating from left to right +/-10 degrees and its effects on the spine.

 

The seat is designed to provide secure support to the rider's body even at the maximum swing of 10 deg side to side. What's more the seat moves slightly up as it rotates thus making sure that the rider always maintains perfect balance regardles whether she/he is riding straight or making a turn.

 

Namo Seat is unique because as it rotates it creates a smaller “effective profile”. As it swings from side to side it changes it's top view shape which allows for more leg room.

A wider seat means more surface area therefore the ischial bones (the bones which make contact with the seat) can have more space for comfort. More space equals proper rest on the seat.

 

 

The below illustration shows comparison between traditional (fixed) seat and Namo Seat rotated 10 degrees to the left. It clearly shows that in spite of wider profile, effective profile of Namo Seat is narrower than that of a traditional seat! For a full range of motion it means smaller profile by as much as 16mm when compared to a comparable traditional seat.

In short Namo Seat is both: more comfortable and sportier!

 There is no other seat in the world that can do this.

 

 

Upper (swinging) part of the seat can be disconnected from the main body and replaced with different size or style of Namo Seat making it greatly customizable and adaptable to varying requirements of different riders.

 

 

 

Knowing all the advantages of Namo Seat over traditional seats, what would you choose?

 Pain or no pain?

 

The main structural element of the seat is based on a shell design which ensures a high strength to low weight ratio.

1. Stress at 2x 100kgf

 

 

1. Deflection at 2x 50kgf

 

The above examples show the shell performing under the load of up to 200kgf (441 lbf).

 

Namo Seat is designed for standard seat post mounting configuration and most common 7mm diameter rails.

Shown dimensions are in millimeters.

 

 

 

 

We have built our first rig which was used to test the functionality of the concept. We have also built our first real size Namo Seat to verify visual and other properties.

Our work, however, is not yet finished. This process is a process of continuous creation and some aspects of the design can still be changed. Via this campaign, you may provide your opinions which in turn help us improve the final design. We need to know your likes and dislikes. Your opinions may tremendously improve our understanding of how the seat should look and perform in its final form.

 

 

Our endeavor is only beginning but we have already invested significant amount of time and energy into the project. Our work turned out to be challenging and rewarding at the same time. There is still a lot we have to do to make it happen but we believe that together with your support we can do it in a timely manner.

We have tested and verified ourselves the functionality of the seat. We rode bicycles with our test rig mounted and we can unequivocally say that the seat works as predicted giving the rider freedom to move the way he/she requires to. We also understand that making a bicycle component that is so critical to the overall experience of comfort and sportiness requires complex studies and involved engagement of all available assets including significant financial resources. We can do most of the work but the financial aspect of the project needs your contribution. Therefore every bit of your support can make a difference in bringing this unique seat closer to reality. We are fully committed to this project and would love to give you a chance to enjoy natural motion bicycle riding as soon as possible.

Our goals are clear and structured. We want to finish development of the seat by fall of this year and start preparations for preproduction shortly after. We have designed all the parts and identified all materials. We are ready to start talking to potential suppliers and organize the logistics but all estimates indicate that first preproduction seat should be available early next year (circa February/March 2014) and the final production parts by mid July 2014. In the meantime we need to purchase materials and tools necessary to satisfy production requirements on a continuous basis.

This campaign is about raising funds to move an extraordinary bicycle seat we call Namo Seat (patent pending) from development phase to production.

Estimated schedule

August 2013– End of Indiegogo campaign

November 2013– End of development

March 2014 – Preproduction parts

July 2014 – Production and delivery to customers

 

We need your help to finalize our preproduction development of Namo Seat and go into mass production.

Here is how we will invest the funding we receive:

1) Preproduction Seat Development: We have started the preproduction parts development but the majority of the funding requested will be applied to complete final parts development, additional testing as well as optimizations and modifications required by production suppliers.

2) Mass Production: We need your support to secure procurement of the long lead components (tooling) and meet the minimum order quantities required.

With your support we expect to have the first Namo Seat in your hands by early July 2014.

The amount of funding we require to achieve the final milestones is $100,000. We hope you find this project exciting and will support us with this unique and valuable technology.

We are very excited about this project and hope you are too. Please share Namo Seat with your friends too!

We truly appreciate your support.

 

We at Namo Dynamics are a small but dedicated team of people who brought together a rich and versatile set of skills that allowed for the development of the first natural motion bicycle seat. The inventor behind Namo Seat is a long time design engineer whose design services span over many years and have been appreciated by numerous automotive and agricultural corporations in the USA.

Jan is known for his excellent service to John Deere, Case Corporation, Motorola Automotive, Eaton or Siemens Automotive. These are just a few large corporations to name but it was the rich experience of all these members and their high level of expertise in their respective areas of professional activities what allowed for the development of the Namo Seat.

 

By contributing $40 or $75 dollars to our campaign you can choose your T-Shirt. All T-Shirts are made from quality materials and will be professionally produced.

Simply:

1. Select your T-Shirt and choose between vertical and horizontal logo

 2. Select your size

 

  and you are done.

All backers of these percs will be contacted via email about the details of their choices prior to the printing of their Namo T-Shirts.

 

1) When can I expect the delivery of my seat?

As soon as production commences, which according to our latest estimates is going to be by early July of 2014.

2) When can I choose the color of my Namo Seat?

The final selection of colors will be made available following the end of the preproduction stage (March/April 2014). At that time all contributors who ordered Namo Seats will be contacted via emails to confirm their color choices.

3) What is Namo Seat made of?

Aircraft grade aluminum is used for small machined parts, steel used for rails and polymers for the shell of the seat. The material used for the design of the shell of Namo Seat (Polyaryamide) is as strong as aircraft grade aluminum yet it is lighter and, in current version, it is capable of supporting the rider's weight of up to 130kg (286lb)

4) Are the shells interchangeable?

YES. Namo Seat has modular capability and the upper section of the seat (moving part) can be disconnected from lower (not moving) part and upgraded with another natural motion seat.

5) If I have further questions where can I contact Namo Dynamics?

You can reach us via email at: support@namodynamics.com

Have more questions about Namo Seat?
Discuss Namo Seat @ crowdfundingforum.com!

story:
We've been working with some of the most influential, positive, proactive groups in our country to develop the MediStori & hears what they have to say about it...

Bernard Duggan, a members of the Irish Pharmacy Union’s (IPU) Executive committee, said, "Community Pharmacists support their patients on a daily basis in managing their complicated medication regimens. They ensure that they take their medications as prescribed and provide patients with advice and information on these medications."

"The MediStori is an innovative tool, which assists patients to manage their medication safely in conjunction with their Community Pharmacist."

CEO of the Irish Patients Association, Stephen McMahon highlights that the MediStori is a patient safety initiative... [see www.medistori.com/medicalnews]

"The National Carer’s Strategy highlights that carers are extremely vulnerable & that there is a major lack of resources for voluntary carers in Ireland. Many carers are family or friends which have been suddenly thrown into a position of looking after someone on a full/part time basis. Often there are fears of under/over dosing & the responsibility may lie with the carer if there is no paper trail of what the patient took last. If a paramedic were to turn up, for example, they may not be able to know what the patient’s medical history is or who the next of kin is. Many parents of sick children have said that this is a really frightening experience to be suddenly, not just a mum, but a carer and nurse all in one. But there are many other aspects in managing a person’s health, such as managing appointments, storing medical results & ensuring others have quick & easy access to your information in the case of an emergency [e.g. not password protected nor electricity reliant>.

We feel that the MediStori is an invaluable tool to help carers keep their loved ones medical information together in one unit & to have their most accurate & up to date information, easily accessed at any one time, by any of the health care providers associated with that person. It offers carers a simple yet effective solution to help manage all aspects of one’s health, which in turn can increase patient safety & give the carer peace of mind. "

Hi there, I’m Olive. And this is my MediStori...

I am a mum to 3 beautiful girls whom each have had complex, chronic illnesses.  From heart surgeries, mixed connective tissue disorders, autoimmune disease & a current process of trying to diagnose rare tumours, our little family know first-hand the stresses that come from managing medications, trying to get diagnosed & juggling appointments, along with everyday life!

But even with all this going on, including my young husband having a TIA (stroke) it was actually when my dad came out of hospital after a 9 week stay in hospital on a whopping 22 medications that I knew I wasn’t the only one struggling with all of these issues!

Like many his age he didn't use apps or technology and so I decided to try to create a solution to this global problem and knew it had to be something that:

1) needed to be easy to use

2) could store all correspondence from all health practitioners

3) could keep an entire families history in one unit &

4) that it could help record both past medical history & all the on-going stuff too.

And so, the MediStori was born.

Used together or separately, the MediStori& Memos aim to reduce the many stresses, risks & responsibilities that come with managing an illness, therefore allowing you or your loved one to just focus on getting better. They also provide the critical link between your various health care providers & allow you to have the most up to date information to hand in the case of an emergency.

 


Inside the small durable MediStori Folder you will find an amazing amount of stuff:

·  1 x Personal Health Records That Can Be Used From Birth or Started Any Age

·  (more can be added to for each family member as your family grows)

·  1 x Household & Emergency Booklet – Ideal for Carers of Babysitters

·  (you can add the directions to your house if carer needed to ring  ambulance)

·  1x My Medical Diary – For When you Need to Write Down Questions for GP

·  1x Appointment & Everyday Life Calendar – Because life still goes on!

·  1 x MediStori Pen – Impossible to find one, just when you need one!

·  8 x Specialised Wallets to store

·  Medical & Insurance Cards

·  Most Recent Prescription

·  Discs or Reports (MRIs/Scans)

·  Medical Receipts

·  Hospital / GP Correspondence

·  Blood Results / Diagnosis

·  Photos of Birthmarks / Rashes

·  Informational Leaflets

(Basic layout will be the same but colours will vary)

The ongoing management diaries are key to managing daily life. The Medicine Memo is so easy to use - simply write your medications on the left hand side, log the time on the right...at the end of the week, turn over the log time section and your med stay in place, so no need to re-write over & over again!

Other Memos range from food, pain, mood and even new baby diaries and follow the same format as the Medicine Memos. I have also been working with associations & charities to bring out a very specific range of Memos for particular diseases i.e. diabetes, asthma, arthritis & so on!



The MediStori Movement!

 

The MediStori Movement – Take Control of You & Your Families Health Records!

From the first day I ever had the idea of the MediStori, I always believed that it could potentially play a huge role in helping patients, carers & parents alike create positive, long-lasting change in our health system as we know it. Just by simply taking a little bit of control over our own health & learning how to communicate more efficiently with our caregivers, we can all reach the same outcome together- to simply get better...quicker! So, please get behind, not just the MediStori, but what I feel it can achieve - a positive, proactive change in our health systems across the world as we know it now, led by us; the patients, the carers & the parents.

So, please get behind, not just the MediStori, but what I feel it can achieve - a positive, proactive change in our health systems across the world as we know it now, led by us; the patients, the carers & the parents.

So I ask you, What’s Your MediStori?

   

But why do we need your help?

What We Need, What You Get (And How By Helping US, You Can Help Others!)

It was apparent from day one that many people (especially of my dad's age) didn't go online & if they did, were way too wary to share their credit card details to shop online. So how would they learn about or even buy the MediStori?

I knew I would have to make it accessible to as many people as possible...and as simply as possible. And what better place to this than our local, helpful pharmacy! The only problem is, it costs me more to do it this way but I truly want everyone that NEEDS it to be able to have ACCESS to it.

We Believe for this to Work We Need It To Be Integrated On a National Level

&

So We Need Your Help To Do This!

So, I'm here because simply put…WE need funds to get going properly!


We thought long & hard about how we would raise funds & we thought that crowd-funding while raising money for charity would be the best way to go! So now, not only will all monies raised help get the MediStori off the ground 10% of that will directly HELP THOSE WHO REALLY NEED IT :)

We have had to use many charities over the years for supports & services & so we carefully picked local & national charities that we will be donating to. These charities will split the monies raised equally between themselves at the end of the crowd funding. We will start with one charity initially and then unlock new charities as the campaign grows. It doesn’t matter what time the charity starts in at in the campaign, they will still be able to split the full amount equally at the end. (Remember, Indiegogo charge us a 4% fee of the €50,000 target if we make it on time or a 9% fee if we don't. So the push is on to not only hit target – but to double it or better…therefore we will have more to give the charities!)

Our National Charity is - Heart Children Ireland!

 

This is because every one of us in our little family have a little something going on with our hearts! My hubby & eldest daughter, Micaela both have the same hole in their hearts (my hubby only finding this out after he had a stroke!), I have a thing called Bradycardia & am on longterm steroids for same, my 10 year old daughter Nicole has Arrhythmias& my youngest daughter Mackensie had major heart surgery at 5 weeks old for three holes in her heart. Thankfully we're all doing good right now, but I have to say the support I received from Margaret Rogers and the Heart Children Ireland team was just beyond amazing. I did a massive coffee morning many years ago for this charity because these guys need such a serious amount of funds to be raised for what they do every day.

WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO……

“Heart Children Ireland is a support group for parents and families of children with a Congenital Heart Disorder.  CHD is the most common of all birth defects affecting one in every one hundred children born at present. About half of all babies born with CHD will require heart operations.  We are a nationwide organisation with over 1,000 member families.  We were founded in 1990 and are a registered charity.  We are a completely voluntary group and receive no government funding.  We depend on our own fundraising and donations from individuals and business.  Over the last 22 years we have raised over €2.5m euro for the cardiac unit in Our Lady’s Children’s Hospital, Crumlin.  We also support the Young Adult Congenital Unit at the Mater Hospital and in 2011 we opened The Maurice Neligan Congenital Heart Clinic for this unit. We currently run a nationwide Family Support Service and urgently need funds to continue this vital service.”

Visit here for more info on what they do...  www.heartchildren.ie

By supporting the MediStori movement like they are, they too will also reap the rewards!

Remember, every little cent helps a little heart!!


Our local charity is – Áirc.

When I asked what the name meant, their wonderful chairperson, Angela, told us that it was Irish for Ark – as in Noah’s Ark – and the reason they chose this was because every single animal was represented and allowed on to the Ark – which is what their charity is: a support group for all children regardless of their disability. Cool, heh?

Áirc were kind enough to allow me to run the first feasibility group for the MediStori project. So, here’s just a little background information & you’ll see why I am so fond of what they do.

“Originally set up in 2009 as the parents group of Mayo Early Intervention Services, ÁIRC is now due to demand, extending to cover families of children with disabilities up to the age of 18 or leaving 2nd level education, whichever comes last. Our aims are to provide resources (both financial and human), communication (in the form of education and communication between parents or parents and the service) and to advocate.   If you have a child with a disability you are by default considered to be part of the ÁIRC family and we will represent you in any way you require when possible using whatever resources we have available to us.”

Contact Áirc on: http://www.aircmayo.com/https://www.facebook.com/AIRCMAYO

SO, WHAT DO WE (the MediStori Team) Need Funds For?

We need funds for marketing, PR, stock, staff & administration to name but a few. I would also love to create employment in Ireland& so am looking to hire an e-commerce marketing assistant also. (Also, I run all aspects of my business on my own and would love to have a team member to work with - I have been so lucky to have great supports from family, friends and mentors )

We need to raise €50,000 realistically to do this right and to be able to get it to as many pharmacies as possible. Now I know by giving 4% to Indiegogo and then 10% to charities that this lowers the overall target but I'm okay with this as I really believe in the cause...and hey, we aim to go way over target!!!

Speaking About Proactive Change with An Taoiseach...

I have already received fantastic support from Enterprise Ireland (receiving €15,000 in funds to start up) and this has all been put into the research and development of the MediStori. I have worked with many, many focus groups including parents, carers & pharmacists plus have completed surveys to get as much feedback as possible. I don't believe in "negative feedback"...I have always turned it into "research & development" and listened to the needs of the patients, carers & parents.

So, I'm sure you're asking what do you get for investing in the MediStori Movement?

Well as you can see from the start we have a range of perks from €5 right up to the €5,000 mark & for every single amount, 10% of it goes directly to the charities we have chosen! And…you become part of the very proactive, MediStori Movement!

The Impact your contribution can have: Scary Statistics in REAL TERMS



The MediStori aims to reduce the many associated stresses that come with managing a chronic illness and allows the patient to just focus on getting better. But it can do so much more than that too. There are countless documents on the major issues within health systems that costs them millions & sadly also costs people’s lives. Many, many people have tried to solve these individual issues of the patient but instead they should be looking at the patient as an individual with many issues.

The fact that there are 1.3 million people in Ireland alone with a chronic illness such as asthma, arthritis, blood pressure, heart disease, cancer, depression etc. shows that our health systems are under massive strain because of this very issue also!

Now just add the simple fact that stress can CAUSE illness!

The MediStori can significantly help reduce the stresses of managing a chronic illness & can potentially reduce all of these above scary statistics. So just by using the MediStori you too are becoming part of the positive, proactive “MediStori Movement” & all you have to do is keep using it & engaging with your caregivers to reap the benefits! But to create change, we need to know what has to change first.

And so I also hope to allow people to share their own “MediStori’s” on our website to try & make this happen.

Remember you don’t have to be sick to use the MediStori...from the day we are born we should be keeping records and this helps you do just that!And don’t forget, it would be one of the best gifts you could ever buy somebody x

Other Ways You Can Help…

I myself have been an active volunteer & fundraiser for many, many years for various different charities & I know how hard times are for people. I’m qualified in Youth Leadership and was chairperson of the LDYN which raised essential funds for their youth centre in our town. I also admin a very successful suicide awareness page called EasySpeak, which to date has over 12,000 members.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/easyspeak/

So, I completely understand that some of you may not be able to contribute, and that’s okay but you can still help the cause if you’d like!

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign – you can do this via your emails, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn, even text people if you’d like! (You never know who in your circles may just need the MediStori right now!)
  • Remember you can use all the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Just send good thoughts my way and I'll keep smiling :) !

story:
A Camp For Kids Fighting Cancer and Blood Disorders

Last year Phoenix Children’s Hospital Center for Cancer and Blood Disorders newly-diagnosed more than 270 children with some form of cancer. The Center also treated 132 children with sickle cell disease, and many others with chronic or life-threatening blood disorders.  These conditions change a child’s life in many ways. Some spend weeks or even months in the hospital. They undergo treatments that cause fatigue, nausea, and hair loss. They take medications with severe side effects, and endure various surgical procedures. They experience hardships that force them and their families to redefine what it means to be a kid.

That’s why Phoenix Children's Hospital sends more than 120 patients to camp each year – free of charge. At Camp Rainbow in the Arizona high country our patients develop lifelong friendships, escape the everyday struggles of cancer treatment, and have the experience of a lifetime.


You can make this dream come true for a camper by sponsoring a patient. 

A Wild Adventure

Camp Rainbow is a week-long, summer camp held exclusively for children who have, or have had, cancer or a chronic blood disorder. Every year, Camp Rainbow welcomes over 120 children ages 7-18 to the Camp Friendly Pines in Prescott, Arizona. At camp, children are divided into cabins by age and gender, with each cabin supervised by at least two volunteer counselors. Nurses and doctors serve as staff members each year to ensure that camp activities are performed safely and that the campers’ medical needs are met. 

A typical day for campers begins with breakfast followed by morning activities, which can include everything from swimming, rock climbing and fishing to arts and crafts and camp sing-alongs. Every evening, camp features a different teambuilding activity, like silly Olympics or a dance. Campers are even given a chance to “get back” at their doctors by challenging them to silly string and food fights. For campers ages 16-18, Camp Rainbow also has a Counselor in Training (CIT) program. Through this program, CITs learn valuable leadership and organization skills. Many go on to become Camp Rainbow staff members, which allows adult survivors the chance to stay engaged with the camp and offer support and hope to children and teens who are fighting the same battle they once did.


Camp Rainbow is staffed 24/7 by physicians, nurse practitioners and registered nurses. With one full time Camp Rainbow director, the remaining staff members are all volunteers. Camp Rainbow is accredited by the American Camp Association (ACA), which upholds the highest standards for organized camping.

Help Us Send More Happy Campers!

At age 6, Owen (below) was diagnosed with bone cancer when a solid tumor was found in his left femur. Along with chemotherapy, Owen eventually had his entire femur, knee and part of his tibia replaced with metal and plastic implants. Help send a child just like Owen to Camp Rainbow this year. The memories they make will be priceless.


How To Help

  • Contribute today. Give generously to the fullest extent that you can. Go beyond "giving back". Invest in today, tomorrow, and hope.
  • Spread the word! Ask your family, friends, and co-workers to help share our campaign on Indiegogo.
  • Stay connected. Check back often as our story and campaign unfolds! Connect with the Phoenix Children's Hospital Foundation through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, email or our website.
  • Volunteer. Interested in becoming a volunteer? At Phoenix Children’s Hospital, we provide our volunteers with specialized training at no cost to them.
story_txt:
A Camp For Kids Fighting Cancer and Blood DisordersLast year Phoenix Children’s Hospital Center for Cancer and Blood Disorders newly-diagnosed more than 270 children with some form of cancer. The Center also treated 132 children with sickle cell disease, and many others with chronic or life-threatening blood disorders.  These conditions change a child’s life in many ways. Some spend weeks or even months in the hospital. They undergo treatments that cause fatigue, nausea, and hair loss. They take medications with severe side effects, and endure various surgical procedures. They experience hardships that force them and their families to redefine what it means to be a kid.That’s why Phoenix Children's Hospital sends more than 120 patients to camp each year – free of charge. At Camp Rainbow in the Arizona high country our patients develop lifelong friendships, escape the everyday struggles of cancer treatment, and have the experience of a lifetime.You can make this dream come true for a camper by sponsoring a patient. A Wild AdventureCamp Rainbow is a week-long, summer camp held exclusively for children who have, or have had, cancer or a chronic blood disorder. Every year, Camp Rainbow welcomes over 120 children ages 7-18 to the Camp Friendly Pines in Prescott, Arizona. At camp, children are divided into cabins by age and gender, with each cabin supervised by at least two volunteer counselors. Nurses and doctors serve as staff members each year to ensure that camp activities are performed safely and that the campers’ medical needs are met. A typical day for campers begins with breakfast followed by morning activities, which can include everything from swimming, rock climbing and fishing to arts and crafts and camp sing-alongs. Every evening, camp features a different teambuilding activity, like silly Olympics or a dance. Campers are even given a chance to “get back” at their doctors by challenging them to silly string and food fights. For campers ages 16-18, Camp Rainbow also has a Counselor in Training (CIT) program. Through this program, CITs learn valuable leadership and organization skills. Many go on to become Camp Rainbow staff members, which allows adult survivors the chance to stay engaged with the camp and offer support and hope to children and teens who are fighting the same battle they once did.Camp Rainbow is staffed 24/7 by physicians, nurse practitioners and registered nurses. With one full time Camp Rainbow director, the remaining staff members are all volunteers. Camp Rainbow is accredited by the American Camp Association (ACA), which upholds the highest standards for organized camping.Help Us Send More Happy Campers!At age 6, Owen (below) was diagnosed with bone cancer when a solid tumor was found in his left femur. Along with chemotherapy, Owen eventually had his entire femur, knee and part of his tibia replaced with metal and plastic implants. Help send a child just like Owen to Camp Rainbow this year. The memories they make will be priceless.How To Help

Contribute today. Give generously to the fullest extent that you can. Go beyond "giving back". Invest in today, tomorrow, and hope.

Spread the word! Ask your family, friends, and co-workers to help share our campaign on Indiegogo.

Stay connected. Check back often as our story and campaign unfolds! Connect with the Phoenix Children's Hospital Foundation through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, email or our website.

Volunteer. Interested in becoming a volunteer? At Phoenix Children’s Hospital, we provide our volunteers with specialized training at no cost to them.

story:
The energy of the Earth is everywhere around us and we can draw up from it in different ways and from different places. Energy has no colour, shape or smell. But its effect can be perceived by every single sense. Energy can not be touched but it can be felt. It does not produce any sound, but we can definitely hear it. Once we allow ourselves to listen to it carefully, time stops, thoughts subside, the mind becomes still, the heart beats regularly and in tune with the heart of Mother Earth.

story:
This campaign is sponsored by Friends of John Self and Family. Johnny is not aware that we are attempting this effort. He has been down for a couple of weeks, in need of a surgery that is preventing him from working. Without insurance, it is taking him awhile to be in a position to pay up front for the surgery, which of course is adding insult to injury because he cannot work. It is a vicious cycle and we were just hoping to be able to help him get a jump on getting the surgery scheduled so he can get back to working the pipelines and provide for his family.

All proceeds will go directly to his medical expenses. The purpose of the fund is to help get him to surgery as quickly as possible.

Friends of John know that he is on the road working throughout most of the year. He is always the first to jump in with his family's cook team and fire up the folks he knows to raise money for those in need. We just thought it would be a big help to them if we could return some of their good deeds.

I know it is the time of year that everyone has their hands out asking you to support their causes. He will make it without our help, but it just prolongs their recovery, the longer it takes for him to get back to work. A couple of bucks shared among friends may make a big difference.

Thanks in advance for your consideration and friendship.

story:
Overview 

Men need hair care and skin care products in order to feel healthy and confident. It’s not just about looking your best, but about feeling your best. The majority of male grooming products on the market don’t address beard and body hair health. Andiva is a men’s cosmetics line dedicated to making that happen. Our Tieso and Rapido line of products is unlike any other men’s beard hair and body hair line on the market. Tieso Cleansing Gel, Soothing Cream, and Rapido Spray get to the core of hair health and freshness. 


Our Mission

Tieso and Rapido products promote healthier, tamer, and shinier beard and body hair by starting from the source: the skin. We uses natural ingredients to help soothe, moisturize, and remove impurities. Our products get rid of the bacteria that can build up beneath male body hair fights off odor, dry skin, skin redness, and even inflamed hair follicles. These uniquely formulated products also work to detangle and add shine to men’s hair.

Other beard waxes and oils on the market just cover up the problems of smell and tangling on a surface level, but Andiva Tieso and Rapido products stop the bacteria at the source. This is crucial to maintaining a healthy and revitalizing beard and body hair care routine. Take your appearance and personal hygiene to the next level with the products we’ve been so dedicated to perfecting. 


Our Line of Men Facial and Body Hair Products 

Tieso Cleanser Gel

Product Description: 
Tieso Cleanser Gel is specially formulated for men to use during their skin care and hair care routines for a much deeper clean. Unlike other male beard waxes, oils, and perfumes on the market, Tieso Cleanser Gel cleanses and nourishes the skin beneath the hair. Say goodbye to the bacteria that causes poor beard smell and texture, as well as dry, itchy, and irritated skin. This product can also be used to freshen up the groin area. 

Includes: L-Arginine, Maca Root, Purslane Plant Extract, Chamomile Flower Extract 

 

Tieso Soothing Cream 

Product Description: 
After using the Tieso Cleanser Gel, use Tieso Soothing Cream post-shower. This unrivaled male soothing cream not only softens the hair, but prevents tangling and static electricity. Tieso is uniquely formulated to tame and rehydrate any beard or groin area. Turn coarse and unruly hair into smooth and suave hair. 

Includes: Snail Secretin Filtrate, Argan Oil, L-Arginine, Maca Root, Purslane Plant Extract, Chamomile Flower Extract 


Rapido (Easy Grooming Spray)

Product Description: 
Rapido Spray is a nourishing spray for male body hair that can be used at any time throughout the course of the day! Its antimicrobial properties help freshen up the hair and relieve itching and irritation of the skin. It is also rich in natural minerals. Feel confident wherever you are with Rapido Spray at your side. 

Includes: Xylitol (natural sugar replacement), Phellodendri Cortex (Chinese herb tree bark), Maca Root) 


Benefits of using our products

story:
What is the Quidditch World Cup?

The 2016 Quidditch World Cup is where the best quidditch players from around the world will go head to head for ultimate glory, which will take place on the 23rd and 24th of July in Frankfurt, Germany. The Australian Dropbears will be competing at the highest level of quidditch competition in the world. Twenty five countries from across the globe will compete for national pride, more than the previous two international tournaments combined, in what is sure to be a thrilling and intense competition.


What is quidditch?

Quidditch is a mixed-gender full-contact sport with a unique mix of elements from rugby, dodgeball, and tag. For more information about the rules of Quidditch visit the Quidditch Australia website.


Who are the Dropbears?

Twenty one Australian quidditch players have been selected from the best and brightest to represent down under and chase down that elusive gold. They are an elite squad of athletes from Victoria, New South Wales, The Australian Capital Territory and Western Australia lead by a fearsome captain/coach duo. Nine of the twenty one players are returning for another turn and seeking to better their silver medals from last time, and all are out for blood.


Why are we crowd funding and where is the money going?

As a developing sport, Quidditch doesn't have the backing and professional support of most other sporting leagues, consequently, travel to events such as these comes entirely out of the pockets of the players. As an isolated country, travel overseas is often very expensive for Australians, and the cost per person is going to exceed $3,000. One of the key principles of Quidditch is inclusion and we want to ensure all the players who want to go can attend without significant financial detriment. Every cent raised will go towards subsiding player travel, so any amount will help reduce costs and is therefore greatly appreciated.


Projected Income

$10,000

$20,000

Crowdfunding Fees

$800

$1,600

Perk Costs

$5000

$10,000

Shipping

$200

$400

Australian Team Jerseys

$990

$990

Other Equipment

$400

$400

Dropbear Travel Fund

$2610

$6610

What do you get in return?

In return for your support of the team and in addition to our eternal gratitude, you can get some amazing rewards such as exclusive Dropbears t-shirts, Dropbears player cards, and even your very own limited edition Dropbears jersey. You will also leave with the knowledge that you are enabling the future of competitive quidditch within Australia.


T Shirt Design 1


T Shirt Design 2

T Shirt Design 3



About Quidditch Australia

Quidditch Australia is a not for profit organization formed in 2011 who are committed to facilitating the sport of quidditch throughout Australia. Our mission is to coordinate the growth of quidditch in Australia and to support the participation of people of all ages in sport to promote an active and healthy lifestyle. Quidditch Australia runs the annual Oceania Championships, and supports state and local competitions and teams.


If you have any questions, feel free to email us at media@quidditch.org.au or visit us on the following pages. Want to play quidditch? Find your local team on the Australian Quidditch Website.


Website

Facebook

Youtube


Note - If you are attending Mudbash or Midwinter, please select 'Aland Islands' for shipping, you can then pick up your rewards in person. Clothing size and personlistion requests will be sent out towards the end of the campaign. If you have any questions, please email us at media@quidditch.org.au

Cover photo by Janet Hoffar Photography

story:
**Thanks so much to everyone who contributed to The Tyler Fund! Your generosity, kindness and support have meant so much to Tyler and his family. Please continue to check this site for updates on Tyler's progress and to leave him notes of encouragement! ~ No one fights alone!**

The Tyler Fund

 

I am asking for your support on behalf of Tyler Schroeder.

An adventurous life decision brought Tyler to South Korea to teach English. After living there for almost two years, he has acquired a celebrity status in his hometown of Yeosu. His imposing frame and blonde hair have always elicited attention, but at 6’2 this former champion football player is a stark contrast to the petite Korean population.

Tyler has always supported his community, whether it is his hometown of Tipton Iowa, Arizona State University or Iona College. He is intelligent, kind, and caring.

Tyler has been embraced by his new and old communities of Tipton, Iowa, Arizona State and Iona College. He is kind, strong, capable, stable, adventurous, athletic, brave, reliable, clever, sensible and incredibly cool. He understands the comedic nuance from Seinfeld and can answer any Jeopardy question thrown his way. He is a loyal friend and a team player.

Chronic back pain brought Tyler to a hospital in Seoul and two weeks ago he was diagnosed with a rare form of cancer called Primitve Neuroectodermal (PNET).

The pain originally accredited to a slipped disc, was a malignant tumor at the C1 and C2 vertebrae. Immediate surgery was necessary to relieve the pain and Tyler’s Parents, Jody and Rusty, immediately flew from Iowa to Seoul.

The Korean health care system is substantially different than what we are used to in the United States. Jody and Rusty arrived at the hospital and were astonished to see men and women milling about everywhere in their hospital attire. Although the Wooridul Spine Hospital is world renown, the main lobby was strangely reminiscent of a crowded bus station.

Tyler received different room rate options at the hospital: the more roommates the cheaper the room. Keeping in line with his usual character, he chose the $10 dollar a day room so he could be with six other patients. This would allow him to stay immersed in Korean culture while making new friends. Luckily one roommate was an English speaking Korean high school teacher and they quickly came to the Shroeder’s aid. The “no frills plan” ended up being the perfect choice!

After undergoing a grueling 11 hour surgery doctors were able to remove 80% of the tumor without risking nerve damage that would impact his mobility. Tyler recovered speedily in the ICU with Jody and Rusty by his side and waited for the results of the pathology report.

Before the report came back, Tyler underwent a second surgery to release the buildup of fluid collecting at the base of his neck. Since then Tyler has been relieved of his headaches and is now able to sit up for longer periods of time and even remove his neck brace for short periods.

The pathology report confirmed that the tumor was malignant and that Tyler has an extremely rare form of cancer. The doctors in Seoul recommended that Tyler return to the United States to continue treatment. We are currently still searching for the best option to transport him home. Upon returning to the US Tyler will be admitted to Mayo Clinic in Minnesota for treatment. This world renowned Medical Centre makes miracles on a daily basis.

Tyler has a grueling path ahead of him, but with the support of family and friends we can help him beat this disease, and help to ease the increasing pressures on his family. The Tyler Fund is dedicated to supporting Tyler fight cancer. Please show your support and love through kind words and donations.

What We Need

  • The money raised here will be used for Medical expenses, transportation costs, housing for his family while Tyler is undergoing treatment, and other unforeseen costs.
  • There is no amount that is “too little”, whether its $5 or $500!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Forward this website and/or Facebook page to everyone you know!
  • Email friends and family and ask for their support

 

THANK YOU

story:
Our Story

HEADLINE Did you know there is a cure for alzheimer's and dimentia?
Hi I'm Ron Linda's son.  I have been taking care of my mom since she was diagnosed with dementia in October 2009.  I am always searching for new medicines and cures for dementia and I recently discovered a breakthrough method reported by 60 Minutes Australia.  As chance would have it, the doctor who performs the method is only 27 miles from our home.  A simple shot snaps dementia patients out of their trance in as quick as 5 minutes.  Hard to believe but it's true.  For those who are caretakers of dementia patients would tell you "it's worth a try if it would give me back my mom".  I promised my mom over 2 years ago when she was diagnosed that I would find a cure for her and I wouldn't give up.  Linda is only 62 years old. 

My goal is to document my mothers progress and success in hopes that this will raise awareness for others who might not know about this procedure.  I want to raise awareness that others like me who take care of their parents are not alone and there are procedures available today that will significantly change everyone's lives. 

I encourage all of you to watch the 60 Minutes Story on this miraculous and promising new method.
I am linking video testimonials and other important information so others can use the share tools to tell the world.
Please post and blog all of the resources I have found as a way to get the word out.  See my links and share tools below.

Please tell everyone about this new way to use the drug Embrel to save a life!  Thank you Ronald Stewart

The Impact

As of two weeks ago, more people are diagnosed with alzheimer's and dementia than cancer.  The potential impact is this process can cure many sufferers of this disease and restore family members and loved ones lives.

HEADLINE "There is a cure for alzheimer's and dimentia" but its pricey at the moment.

What this shot does is reduce swelling in the brain that 'short circuits' their cognitive functions.  Once the swelling is reduced simple tasks like speaking come back instantly.  This technique is called Enbrel perispinal injection


Watch this YouTube Video

What We Need & What You Get

The cost of this procedure is pricey but the reason why I chose Indiegogo is I thought "what if we all shared in the cost"?  Then the hefty price of nearly 5000.00 diminishes when shared with many.

The amount I am raising pays for the initial treatments by the doctor, including her exams and most importantly the actual shots to reduce the inflammation in and around the brain.

The really good news is Linda has not lost it all like many others.  In fact her type of dementia affects mainly her speech and some motor skills.  I am optimistic about this procedure because this treatment has a tremendous upside for her exact type of dementia called 'aphasia'

I know there are scoffers and skeptics out there but regardless of the outcome I know this procedure will help someone and that makes all of this worth it :)

Please join me in this journey of how we can all "get our mothers back", as I will be updating and documenting her progress.  To my brothers and sisters in Christ, let's all claim victory in advance and shout at once to knock down this wall just like at Jericho in the Old Testament. 

I will combine this fund raising campaign with both my own monies and at our Church here in Hollywood FL to insure we reach our goal so that Linda can get this treatment.  Your contribution will count!


Other Ways You Can Help

Share Tools, Share Tools and more Share Tools


60 Minutes Story

Quick News Clip

Video Testimonials

Keynote Address

Dr. Tobinick

Actual Patent On Procedure
story_txt:
Our Story
HEADLINE Did you know there is a cure for alzheimer's and dimentia?Hi I'm Ron Linda's son.  I have been taking care of my mom since she was diagnosed with dementia in October 2009.  I am always searching for new medicines and cures for dementia and I recently discovered a breakthrough method reported by 60 Minutes Australia.  As chance would have it, the doctor who performs the method is only 27 miles from our home.  A simple shot snaps dementia patients out of their trance in as quick as 5 minutes.  Hard to believe but it's true.  For those who are caretakers of dementia patients would tell you "it's worth a try if it would give me back my mom".  I promised my mom over 2 years ago when she was diagnosed that I would find a cure for her and I wouldn't give up.  Linda is only 62 years old.  My goal is to document my mothers progress and success in hopes that this will raise awareness for others who might not know about this procedure.  I want to raise awareness that others like me who take care of their parents are not alone and there are procedures available today that will significantly change everyone's lives.  I encourage all of you to watch the 60 Minutes Story on this miraculous and promising new method.I am linking video testimonials and other important information so others can use the share tools to tell the world.Please post and blog all of the resources I have found as a way to get the word out.  See my links and share tools below.Please tell everyone about this new way to use the drug Embrel to save a life!  Thank you Ronald Stewart

The Impact
As of two weeks ago, more people are diagnosed with alzheimer's and dementia than cancer.  The potential impact is this process can cure many sufferers of this disease and restore family members and loved ones lives.
HEADLINE "There is a cure for alzheimer's and dimentia" but its pricey at the moment.
What this shot does is reduce swelling in the brain that 'short circuits' their cognitive functions.  Once the swelling is reduced simple tasks like speaking come back instantly.  This technique is called Enbrel perispinal injection

Watch this YouTube Video


What We Need & What You Get
The cost of this procedure is pricey but the reason why I chose Indiegogo is I thought "what if we all shared in the cost"?  Then the hefty price of nearly 5000.00 diminishes when shared with many.The amount I am raising pays for the initial treatments by the doctor, including her exams and most importantly the actual shots to reduce the inflammation in and around the brain.The really good news is Linda has not lost it all like many others.  In fact her type of dementia affects mainly her speech and some motor skills.  I am optimistic about this procedure because this treatment has a tremendous upside for her exact type of dementia called 'aphasia'I know there are scoffers and skeptics out there but regardless of the outcome I know this procedure will help someone and that makes all of this worth it :) Please join me in this journey of how we can all "get our mothers back", as I will be updating and documenting her progress.  To my brothers and sisters in Christ, let's all claim victory in advance and shout at once to knock down this wall just like at Jericho in the Old Testament.  I will combine this fund raising campaign with both my own monies and at our Church here in Hollywood FL to insure we reach our goal so that Linda can get this treatment.  Your contribution will count!Other Ways You Can Help


Share Tools, Share Tools and more Share Tools
60 Minutes Story
Quick News Clip
Video Testimonials
Keynote Address
Dr. Tobinick
Actual Patent On Procedure

story:
Hello Out There!

My name is Sarah and I am a senior nursing student at a diploma school in Roxborough, Pennsylvania. Nursing is my passion and serving others has made a significant impact on me. I have experienced many obstacles throughout my journey to become a nurse and I am so proud to be arriving at the moment where I will be able to say I have accomplished my dream. However, I have another dream. A few days ago I was accepted to be a part of a volunteer medical team that will be traveling to Cambodia in September 2014. When I found out, I nearly cried.

I need your help! The trip will cost approximately $5,500. The expenses will include substandard accommodations for the volunteers as well as medical equipment and resources that will help fund our ability to provide the most beneficial medical services to the people of the community.

The organization through which I am going on this trip is International Medical Relief.  This is a well-established non-profit organization that provides care to underserved communities in all different areas of the world.

Please refer to the website for more information http://www.internationalmedicalrelief.org/.

This trip is very important for many people. We live in a country where medical care is at its most advanced. We are so fortunate to be able to receive this type of care and that our struggle is only monetary. Please donate to this trip, so that we can take our knowledge, experience, and compassion to provide these services to others who may not otherwise have the opportunity!

Think about yourself, your families, your friends, your loved ones… What would you do if you knew that just a couple of dollars could help bring medical care? It is your generous donation that will make a “world” of difference.

In the event that you are unable to contribute financially, please contribute to this cause by keeping the trip and the volunteers in your prayers. Please also help to spread the word about our cause for others who may be interested in donating by using the Indiegogo “share” tools!!

-S

story:
“A photographer gets people to pose for him. A yoga instructor gets people to pose for themselves.” 

                                                                                                     ~ Jay Fields

My name is Paulina and I have the best job ever.

I lead yoga and gym classes for kids and families!

I've been interested in teaching for as long as I can remember. After high school, I applied to Dawson College in Child Studies, intending to eventually continue on to a career in education at the secondary level. But life's paths are never straight! Two years ago I fell into teaching recreational gymnastics at a The Little Gym franchise (currently Gym Junior), where I found my calling.

Movement! Dancing! Creativity! Silliness! I was in love.

Then, a little over one year ago, I rediscovered my own love for yoga.

After practicing regularly for a few months, I decided that I need to share yoga with the kids and families I work with, so I did a certification with Rainbow Kids Yoga in July 2013. It was a highly rewarding and educational experience. I have since graduated from college and am now majoring in Child Studies at Concordia University.  I'm also involved with helping to plan the Kids Program of the 2014 Yoga Festival Montreal which will take place in June. I am fortunate to be working with a diverse and knowledgeable team, from whom I'm learning a lot....

And now I'm ready to learn MORE!

I'm raising funds to help cover the costs of a one-week intensive training in New  York City this summer 2014 at STRALA YOGA.

This would allow me to be a more effective yoga teacher,  not just for the kids I teach but also for the adults who accompany their kids to classes! I love teaching to children, but I have come to love the experience of sharing yoga with adults as well and would like to be a more effective guide for them!


Why yoga? Why Paulina?

There are numerous benefits to practicing yoga, for adults and children alike. Yoga can calm the mind, strengthen the body and teach us about ourselves and each other!

By supporting me in gaining more yoga-knowledge you will be helping me to spread this beautiful practice further.

 

Some of my goals include:

  • Increasing the overall physical activity levels of my community and others.
  • Helping people turn their yoga practice into an all-ages-inclusive family activity.
  • Helping adults and children to realize their full potential and feel amazing about themselves.


What I Need

This fundraising campaign will help me cover all the costs of the training intensive, including tuition, travel and lodging.

  • The tuition for the training intensive is $595, due upon registration.
  • Bus tickets from Montreal to New York City will cost roughly $150.
  • Lodging and meals will cost roughly $1000, depending on the accommodations I find!

If I do not reach my funding goal, for whatever reason, the money raised will be put towards another certification in the field of health and wellness, which contributors will be updated about.

What you Get

I will be offering handwritten thank you cards, artwork made by my students, free private sessions and more! Check out the perks for more details :) 


If you would love to contribute but simply cannot send funds, worry not!

There are other ways you can help me, and I would be grateful if you did any of them :)


  • Share this campaign with your friends and family!
  • Send positive vibes to me!
  • Do some yoga! Or just move around!
  • SMILE!

story: One of the greatest and selfless human beings in this world has seemed to have met her match. I know that with the help of those who she has touched we can take this burden off her shoulders. The money will used for medical supplies. My phone number is 3603058281 if you have any questions. Thanks for the love

story:
NCS - RDA Riding for the Disabled.

We are a group of fifteen, 15-17 year olds that are part of the National Citizen Service. One week of the course involves us doing a social action, which will help our community. The planning process and fundraising for the charity will be done by ourselves. In order to raise this money we are planning on doing a sponsored marathon bike ride, from Mountbatten School in Romsey to Gosport Borough Football Club. We have decided to support RDA Riding for the Disabled due to a personal connection within the group. We are looking to raise money to fund for specialist equipment needed for the children to be able to ride safely and to contribute to the upkeep of renovations.

What will we do with your money?

The money you donate will help towards the costs of specialist equipment which includes saddles, crops, reins and boots. We may also be able to buy riding vouchers for the children who are unable to pay the full costs.

The Impact.

This will allow more mentally and physically disabled children to use the horses and step away from the disabilities as a form of therapy.

How can you help?

Share this link on social networking sites to spread the word and donate any amount you can. Tell anyone you know, family, friends, neighbours etc.
